sourceString: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
targetString: j5 ju1th tin cv k`p kv SARS-CoV kv n5n tin nhiam la mocv kv kv mylagia, bak, leth pu11ny, malaythi kvn k]c, ba kv gu]]r v dithpnea, kivl kvn kuuk l55k` v la nyuuthn5 tin jsak.

sourceString: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.

sourceString: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.

sourceString: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.

sourceString: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.

sourceString: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.

sourceString: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: kvn d1x xuaan dial kvn tin k``p raan, HCoVs ca jv xic v pu]ny ran v kuiy luex in jekv th5n, c`xn5 min c5 rik tusk b` kv dup /caa x`c tin n77x bayrulvn HCoV-NL63 kv, tin ca pay lar thi`k` 5 n77x kvn luex piny l55k` m5 d55t k` China.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: kvvliw, m5 c5 vn HCoVs vmv jv jek 5 bv bu]m v bv naath dsp, k` bv li`p kv ciaax rvi ran, lv jvn cu11 m5 thil bayrulvn m5 d55t kiv luex.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: MERS-CoV n0n jv nhiam kv ru]]n 2012 k` pu]th gu1n ju1th m5 run kv 60 m5 cv moc pneumonia m5 rup-rup kvn thil l1t rokn5 rvi Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: Min ku kvn them dial jv lar vn f66 pek in jekv tusskv d``r cu22c fsaa, th11x pekn5 tin n66x kv gu1thn5 tin k]x b` ca kv lar tin jekv kv r6m kam` nath rvi w55n5 Yursp t5 xuankvn Tunicia.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: kv n5n d11r pay w`lrvw 2019, cu j5 ju1th pneumonia th11x m5 c5 rs thi22k kv luex SARS-CoV-2 cua jv jek k` Wuhan, wec Hubei, China.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: cu srganaydhvcin pusl` pu11nt wec mu]]c jv lar 5 vn mv l``t rs mv v la luex piny l55k` n77xv SARS-CoV-2 ca dux wecmu]]n kvvliw kv ku5c pusl` pu11ny k` cua jv csal 5 COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: kv pay di]k 3, 2020, cua pek m5 90,053 x`thw55 mu]]n kvvliw, kv l511 m5 3.4%.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: pneumonia v kvl m5 te kv nyuuthn5 t5 d5t k` la reep rs kv p0th v bv b0c l55k` m 5rup-rup n66x.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: c`x n5 min SARS-CoV SARS-CoV-2 c``t kv kv f66 nyuaak nucleotide kv c11t m5 82%, cux kvn dh7r5 t5 g66l rvi jiaath c`k`.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: p``r kvn gu`c SARS-CoV-2 kvn HCoVs b1kvl tin k]x nyoothv jv 5 c11t kvn gu1cdivn kv dup t5 k]x.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: kv nhiam, tukdivn kvn j1nydivn kvn ju1th HCoV c``tv.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: kv ku5c vms, SARS-CoV-2 guur kvn ci6k HCoVs b1kvl tin k]x.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: rvwdv, d5t nyuuthn5 COVID-19 cuxv kam kvn SARS-CoV tin k``p naath, v la HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: kv ku5c kvl, luex SARS-CoV-2 nyoothv civx t5 tin nvn kv kv n5n luex` j5 HCoVs, kvvl kv ben kv t5 thil du]]p kvl, nyuutn5 t5 kuiy.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: kv ku5c in d]x, pek m5 tst k` d5t nyuuthn5 COVID-19 b` cetv kv pek in n0n kv k` luex SARS-CoV c`x min kuiy rvyci77.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Di]]kdivn, d7pb` SARS-CoV-2 nyoothv t11 civxn5 HCoVs kvn SARS-CoV tin k``p naath.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: kv ku5c kvl, d6p SARS-CoV-2 d5tv cetn5 kv dux HCoVs in k``p naath.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: kv ku5v ind]x, xotv ba kulv x1c m5 d6p SARS-CoV-2 xookv rs kv ksr k` min cv cop k` naath cet kv t11 in te kv SARS-CoV kvn MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: Guutdv, cet kv ju1th tin k]x HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 ca jv jek rvi c1th.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: m5 dee dsp k` c`th kv thok vn HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 cet kv min tusk k` SARS-CoV xotv ba kulv x1c kv g6r x`c` min b5 lv ben.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: jvn b` gsaayv vn f66 ba nvn m5 vn SARS-CoV-2 nyoothv civx kv d``kn5 fsaa cet kv min tusk k` HCoVs in k``p naath.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: c`x v jvn 5ns, civx SARS-CoV-2 kvvl kv d6pdv kv naath, luexdv, kvn thi1xdv kv fsw min cv ku tusk ba jv guic kv jvn tuk COVID-19 vmv.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: kvn ju1th HCoVs d1x xuaan tin k``p naath n77x nyuuthn5 t5 tst ca kv xic v raan.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: kv du]]p d]divn, derv a thu]k 5 raan cv kvn ju1th HCoVs titi xic.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: kv ri`t in d]x, kvn d1x rvw dee kvn v j5 k`n` ju1th HCoV 2 c5 ksx tusk kv gu11th 2 wal.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: n77xv juey m5 d55t k` raan k` ram 2 took HCoV cv thuuk.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: Ɛn ɣöö bi̱ mɛmɛ tuɔk, bi̱ HCoVs rɔ luɔc puɔ̱ny ran kɛ ta̱a̱ mi̱ röŋ mi jak tin kɔ̱ŋ kä dɔap kɛ ta̱a̱ mi̱ gɛɛr min gaŋ tin kɔ̱ŋ.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: Kɛ thuɔ̱k, ja̱ny in jäny kɛ SARS-COV-2 bɛ ŋuot te puɔ̱ny nɛɛni̱ ti̱ ŋuan tin cɛ käp, bɛ cu ŋuot kɛ mi̱ dap jɛ ɛ naath.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: Mi̱ ca dɔp ɛ lɔ̱ŋ, kɛ rep dɛ kɛ rɔ kä naath, bi̱ käp dɛ cuɔ̱ŋ buɔ̱m ɛ cäŋ lɛ̈y kɛ naath kiɛ dup tin kɔ̱ŋ tin de dɔp kɛ jɛ.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: Kɛ run ni̱ ti̱ ŋuan, kɛn jua̱th da̱ŋ ŋuaan ti̱ti̱ COVs jäl kɛ puɔ̱ny nath, nööŋ kɛ thonythony mi̱ bi̱ la tuk juäth.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: Ɛn juey ɛmɛ /cɛ jɛ go̱r ɛn ɣöö bi̱ kuak tin la nyin lëëni̱ te kut nath.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: Min la dääk diɛn, di̱t dɛɛni̱ jua̱thni̱ SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV /ci̱ kɛn naath dɛp ɛ lɔ̱ŋ, kä rep diɛn kɛ rɔ̱ puɔ̱th nath ca jaa ka̱p kɛ cuɔ̱ŋ.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: Bi̱ kɛnɛ go̱r ɛn ɣöö bi̱ kɛ rɔ̱ moc gua̱th ciɛŋä mi̱ te kɛ thi̱n gua̱th kɛl in ciëŋ kɛ thi̱n kä bi̱ kɛn gua̱th cu go̱rni̱ kä nɛy tin cuc, dɔ̱ŋ bɛ tok kɛ kɛl kiɛ ti̱ ŋuan ti̱ ba rɔ̱ cu rëp kɛ no̱o̱ŋ kä tin kɔ̱ŋ.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Jvn SARS-CoV-2 t22 kv t22 kv rvw t5 c``t kv SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV k` w55 d1x xuan g6r kv HCOVs.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: Jvn d22 mal dsp kiv d22 j2k kv dup t5 nyin xuan c2t kv min j2kv jv k` HCoVs, kv jv gu1th v tst vms.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: Dux dv f66 jvn t22 kv dvy ju1thn5 t5 xuan t5 l1ny kv nyin w2c kiv HCoVs k` t22 kv dvy ju1thn5 ti tst t5 kuiy n5 kvn k` SARS-CoV kiv MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: Jvn bv t2 th5n v la m5 baa guic bv w2 kv t11 ran k` bv rsdv wil rvy ran v th2lv l2y d]divn m5 b5 t2 kams.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: V /k`n ksn n5 ruac k` t11 in b` l2y kv jv k` HCoVs, jvn bv t2 th5n vla m5 b5 lust dv, t11 in caa cak n5 jv, kiv t11dv kvnv t11 in d22 jv jak` th51k kv t11 HCoVs.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Ɛn lëy puɔ̱ny dɛ te jueyni̱ HCoV ɛmɛ puɔ̱ɔ̱ny dɛ, mi thia̱k duɔ̱p in derɛ rɔ mat kä ta̱a̱ ee wal mi̱ cäät kɛ ta̱a̱ in ci̱ tuɔk.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: Juëy mi̱ të rɛy kari̱ raan la jɛ mal ɛ dɔap kɛ ɛ lɔ̱ŋ, kä /ci̱ dɛy kɛ a tëë rɛy jua̱th ɛmɛ.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: Kä i̱nɔ bi̱ min ci̱ jak juey HCoV kä të wa̱nɔ cu ŋot kɛ pëk mi̱ bäär.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: Kɛ kɛn dup da̱ŋ rɛw ɛ tɔ̱, bi̱ jua̱th tin te thi̱n ni̱ wën cu te kɛ riɛk kä ta̱a̱ in wën kä HCoV kiɛ juey in të rɛy kari.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: Kɛ min dɔ̱ŋ, mi̱ ci̱ HCoV mi̱ pay ben rɔ cuɔt kä min të däär kiɛ mi̱ te thin ɛ /kënɛ ni̱ wä kä naath, /cɛ rɔ dɛ a matɛ kä min pay ben, kä ba juey bä.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: Ɛn Juey ɛ të däärɔ bɛ cu të wanɔ ala ɣöö bɛ jua̱th dial cu tok kä naath, bɛ la̱t mi̱ di̱t cu la̱t kɛ no̱o̱ŋ dɛ kɛ jua̱th tin kɔ̱ŋ kɛ pɛ̈th kä bɛ kɛ cu jakä wä puɔ̱ɔ̱ny nath ba naath cu käp.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: Kvn HCoVs dial d22 kv j5`k m5 /k1n kv m5 cv rsdv lu`x vb f66 bv tin nhiam jak` w2 kv w2 rvc.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: K` min gu1c kv nvmv, Jvn HCoVs jvn b` d2rv l`t kvnv tin nhiam kv f66 d2rv kulv w` nhiam.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: Kv gu1th m5 cv jssc vn f66 c5 min nhiam m5 cv w` b2n v la min nhiam kiv min d22 kv c52x kv jsk dv.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: Jvn t11 in k1p kv n5 ju2y cu]x caa b2n nyoth vl``r5 t22 caa g\1r piny kv ku5 ju1thin csal5 SARS vn f66 k`pv naath k` l2y k` tukdv.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: Jvn caa t11 m,5 c2t kv ns b2n th52c vl7x k` caa j2k vn f66 kvn l2y tin j`l d22 ju2y vms mal j2k k` kv min csal5 SARS-CoV IgG m5 c11t kv jv kv nvy dial tin t2 th5n.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: Jvn lvy v csal5 - masked palm covet (Paguma larvata) kiv j57k tin t2k k` thuk caa kv j2k vn f66 jvn c``t kv kv ju2y in caa n66x in csal5 SARS CoV.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: Jvn nvmv caa b2n lat v thu]k vn f66 jvn jvn Ju2y v csal5 SARS caa rspust vn f66 n`kv naath rvy thukn5.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Duxdv f66 caa jv b2n rspust vn f66 l`th raan kuum wu]m kvnv thok m5 d]x k1n l1t vgsa jvn bvcv k` d2rv raan jak` j2kv ju2y in csal5 SARS-CoV, m5 lot n5 f66 caa jv b2n car vn f66 jvn kuum wu]m b` d2rv raan gax kv ksr gu1th m5 tst v c5 mua f66 d2rv raan tit v r]x k` ju2y in csal5 SAR-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: Jvn caa x1c kv p2k m5 cop 80% k` l2y t5 g66l rvy thu]]k rvy Guangzhou kvnv tin l6kv r] kv SARS-CoV tin gax kv pu]ny kv ju1th, jvn b` v du]]p m5 l2y t5 g66l l2y tin caa lat 5 SARS-CoV jvn /caa kv d22 mat th5n.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kvn ti dial vt5 w2 kvn p`l k` tin c5 l5w k` SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: T11 in c5 tusk min g6r kv lvy t5n b22k` SARS-CoV jvn th52kv kv kvc CoV, jvn b` lark v jv csalv SARs m5 maar kvnv Rhinolophus kvc COV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), Jvn t22 k` w11r5 chayna tin l1t kv kv k7l mu]l tu]ru]k.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: Kvn kvc v ti gsw kv kv SARS-CoV kvnv tin gax pu]ny kv dvy ju1thn5 kvnv t11 in bvc min d22 j2k k` SARS-CoV.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kvn kvc v ti COVs kvn mat 88-92% Kv t11 in t2kvkv kvSARS-CoV.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: Jvn mv caa g]rv cv x`c m5 r]x jak` t2 th5n kv t11 in j2kv dvy ju1thn5 v raan.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: Tha̱a̱ŋ Jua̱th ni̱ ti̱ ŋuan cet kɛ SARS kɛ CoV (SL-CoVs) ca kɛ jëk ɛn ɣöö jek kɛ kɛ kä ŋaprɔkɛdhɔ̱t, duŋ dɛ ɣöö / thiɛlɛ kɛl mi ca kuany go̱lä kä WIV1 ala juey mi tek kärɔa.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Bi̱ rät riɛm ran rɔ ri̱t kä 2 (ACE2) ba cu ŋa̱c ɛn ɣöö ɛ jɛn no̱o̱ŋ SARS –CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: WIV1 ca thɛm jek jɛ kä ŋaprɔkɛdhɔ̱t cɛ jɛ nyuoth ɛn ɣöö bɛ te kä ŋaprɔkɛdhɔ̱tni̱ kɛnɛ li̱kli̱kni̱ kɛ naath ɛ jɛn bi̱ ACE2 ku lɛ lor kɛ wä dɛ rɛy räät.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: Ni gɔaa, de nɛy tin cɛ käp kɛ SARS dë kɔn jak ni̱ WIV1 kä gɔaa.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Kä inɔ pa̱ny, ɛn WIV1 nyuothɛ ta̱a̱ mi̱ thia̱k ɛ lɔ̱ŋ kɛ tuk SARS-CoV min jek kɛ kä li̱li̱kni̱, te kɛ pëk mi̱ 95% kä ta̱a̱ in lät kɛ jɛ puɔ̱ny ran.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Cäŋ ɛ jɛn i̱nɔ bä, ta̱a̱ cäätä min te kam jua̱thni̱ da̱ŋ rɛw ɛ ti̱, ŋa̱th kɛ jɛ ɛn ɣöö WIV1 /ciɛ jɛn tuk jua̱th in cɔali SARS-CoV kä li̱kli̱kni̱ /ciɛ kɛn jek kɛ SARS-CoV kä kɛ tɔ̱.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: Kä mat ki̱mni̱ ca MERS-CoV te kä buɔ̱n cät kɛ li̱kli̱k CoV-HKU4 kɛnɛ li̱li̱k CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: Kä li̱kli̱k CoV-HKU4 kɛnɛ MERS-CoV lät kɛ kɛɛl kɛ käp jɔam cuɔ̱ŋ kɛnɛ nɛŋ dɛ rɛc (DPP4), kɛ naŋ jua̱th rɛc.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Ɛn RNA in /thiɛl lua̱ŋ, ɛ jɛn RNA in lät kɛ jek dɛ kɛ MERS-CoV ti̱ ŋuan kɛ kɛn tin thiëk kɛ li̱kli̱k beta-CoVs cua ŋic kä Europe kɛnɛ Api̱ri̱ka.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Amäni̱ tämɛ, /thiɛlɛ MERS-CoV mi̱ te thi̱n canyɔk kɛ jek kä Li̱kli̱kni̱ dɔar.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV kɛnɛ gua̱n thiëëkä dɛ ni̱ CoV-HKU25 mat kɛni̱ 87% kä ciaaŋ tëëkä min të kɛ.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Cäŋ ɛ jɛn i̱nɔ ba̱, li̱kli̱kni̱ /ciɛ kɛn tin kua juey MERS-CoV jek kä kɛ kɛ pɛ̈th.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: Kɛ ta̱a̱ in dɔ̱ŋ, ca thɛm Kui̱c Känyä Ca̱ŋ ɛn ɣöö Jamɛli̱ tin ciëŋ kɛ naath kɛɛl ca kɛ jëk te kɛ MERS-CoV mi̱ të puɔ̱ny diɛn, cät kɛ nɔ bä, Jamɛli̱ tin te kui̱c Känyä Ca̱ŋ tukdiɛn kɛ nyin wi̱i̱ni̱ ti̱ ŋuan kä Api̱ri̱ka.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: MERS-CoV ta̱a̱ dɛ thi̱n cua jɛ ŋic kɛ ram te juey cua la̱th gölä kɛ thuny ti̱ ca ka̱m raar wumni̱ jamɛli̱ tin te kɛ naath kɛɛl, ɛ wëë wa̱ i̱nɔ cuɛ cu nyuoth ɛn ɣöö te MERS-CoV puɔ̱ɔ̱ny jamɛli̱.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: Cua cu ŋa̱c ni̱ gɛaa ɛn ɣöö te ti̱ ŋuan ti̱ nyuoth jɛ, duŋ dɛ ɣöö cua jua̱th ti̱ ŋuan tit pua̱nyni̱ jamɛli̱ tin cɛ käp kɛ MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: Kɛ thuɔ̱k bä, jamɛli̱ tin te kɛ jɔk /ci̱ kɛn juey ɛmɛ jek kɛ jiɔm kä rɔa, jek jɛ bä kɛ tin bee raar thokdiɛn, mi̱ lot ni̱ ɣöö ɛ jɛn duɔ̱p in waa jek ni̱ juey ɛmɛ kɛ jɛ ɛ Li̱kli̱kni̱.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kä i̱nɔ bä, ŋuot thiëc bä ɛn ɣöö gua̱th tin ca jek thin ɛn MERS /thiɛlɛ kɛ ta̱a̱ mi̱ nyuoth jɛ ɛn ɣöö ci kɛ wä gua̱th mi̱ te jamli̱ thi̱n mi̱ kua kɛ pa̱a̱r kɛ ta̱a̱ in ca nyuoth, kɛ thuɔ̱k ca ŋa̱c ɛn dɔp ramɔ jɛ kä ramɔ, kiɛ te duɔp dɔdiɛn mi dɔap kɛ jɛ kä lëy tin te kɛ MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 te nyuak kɛ pek mi̱ 96.2% kɛnɛ CoV RaTG13 li̱kli̱kä kɛ ta̱a̱ in te kɛ jɛ, ca jɛ da̱a̱k kɛ ta̱a̱ li̱kli̱kni̱ tin te kɛ Kil kɛɛl.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Cet kɛ ta̱a̱ in tek kɛ SARS-CoV kɛnɛ MERS-CoV, ci̱ ta̱a̱ rɛ wä gɛ̈r kam SARS-CoV-2 kɛnɛ RaTG13 ci̱ dääk diɛn kɛ ta̱a̱ diɛn kɛɛl cu buɔ̱m ɛ lɔ̱ŋ.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Ɛ jɛn mi̱ lar kɛ jɛ ɛn ɣöö li̱kli̱kni̱ /ciɛ kɛn tin te kɛ SARS-CoV-2 Ɛni̱ mi̱ waa ŋic ɛn ɣöö CoVs ba wä jëk nhiam kɛ guath in bi̱ ben.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Kɛ diɛw, ɛ thuɔ̱k lëy tin të kɛ juey ni̱ SARS-CoV-2 bi̱ kɛ te rɛy lëëni̱ dɔaar tin laa na̱k kɛ kɛnɛ lëy tin la nööŋ kɛ yiëër kä ba kɔak kä thuk in la gual kɛ ŋɔak thi̱n kä Ɣuɣan min te kɛ tuk jua̱thni̱ COVID-19 ɛ jɛn gua̱th in nyuoth jɛ ɛn ɣöö jiɛnɛ kä lëy cuɛ wä kä naath kɛ tukdɛ.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kɛ gör ŋäcä min pay tuɔɔk kɛ gua̱th ti̱ ŋuan kɛ jɛn ja̱a̱l in kɛ juey ɛmɛ kɛ pɛ̈th ci kɛnɛ diw ɛn ɣöö te kɛ ley tin lëth ti̱ bɛ̈cbɛ̈ɛ̈c tin dap kɛ gaat ti ŋuan cet kɛ (Kuɔ̱ɔ̱n) de kɛn te juey beta-CoVs ni kä dieeth kiɛn mi cäät kɛ SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ɛn juey ɛ pay tuɔkɛ ca jek rɛy CoV mat kɛn pek mi̱ 85-92% kɛnɛ SARS-CoV-2 kɛ ta̱a̱ in të kɛ kɛ puɔ̱ny ran.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Kä i̱nɔ bä, cäät kɛ kɛ ta̱a̱ RaTG13 min te kɛ pëk mi̱ 90% ŋuiɛc kɛ jɛ kɛ ta̱a̱ in lät kɛ jɛ puɔ̱ɔ̱ny ran.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Ca rɔ̱ duol kɛ gua̱th rɛw kä SARS-CoV-2 mi̱ cet kɛ juey in la jek kɛ puɔ̱ny jiath, kɛl in nyuak ti̱ ŋuan kɛ no̱o̱ŋ diɛn kɛ (RBD) ti̱ cäät kɛ SARS-CoV-2, kɛ 97.4% ti̱ ca ŋic kɛ ta̱a̱ in te kɛ pi̱ riɛm ran.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Kɛ ta̱a̱ in dɔ̱ŋ, RBDs in te kä SARS-CoV-2 kɛnɛ RaTG13 gua̱c kɛ lɔ̱ŋ, cäŋni̱ min ci̱ ta̱a̱ diɛn wä nhial ɛ lɔ̱ŋ rɛy ɣɔaa.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kɛ gör ŋäcä min nhiam kɛ kui̱ jua̱th lëëni̱ tin lëth cua jɛ nyuoth ɛn ɣöö cɛ te juey mi ca jek kä cuäny, mi̱ cu jɛ nyuoth ɛn ɣöö dëë kɛn ca̱a̱t kɛnɛ SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Cua gör ŋäcä nɛmɛ nhɔk kɛ dup ti kɛnɛ buɔkni̱ ti̱ gööl ti̱ ŋuot kɛ mi̱ gör kɛ tha̱ŋ ŋäcä nɛmɛ ɛ mat kɛ ta̱a̱ in tekɛ juey in te kɛ 86.3% thi̱n ɛ lɔŋ.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ci̱ kɔn ley tin leth bä de ba̱ny raar ɛn ɣöö tekɛ rɛy lëëni̱ tin të kɛ SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: K` 5ns b`, vn t`mv /thivlv x`c m5 thu]k vn f66 l2y dsaar tin leth tin tivn5 5 kvn tin jek kv SARS-CoV-2 kv ku5 d``k` min te kam SARS-CoV-2 kvnv SARS-CoV-2 min c``t kv beta-CoV.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Cal lat v l]x vn f66 t11 c``t min d55t min te kam RBDs k` l2y tin tivn tin l2th tin te kv SARS-CoV-2 min c``t kv beta-CoVs kvnv SARS-CoV-2 ca j2k vn f66 dsap kv n5 jv.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Kv t11 x`c` thukn5 duel5 l22n5 cv nyuoth vn f66 HCoV-NL63 kvnv HCoV-229E kvn d1x rvw tusk kv k` CoVs l5kl5kn5, k` ju1th tin tusk n5 dieeth HCoV-OC43 kvnv HCoV-HKU1 jek kv kv k` ku]]n.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Kv t11 in d]x, HCoV-229E n5 tuk` dv tuskv k` juey l5kl5kn5 CoV m5 d]x, m5 csal5 Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, m5 ci tusk k` Ghana, K` ins b` cua Jamvl5 diw b` vn f66 te rvy divn.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Kv gu1th in d]x, naath b` te kv kvvl kv alpan5.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Rvwdv, HCoV-229E l5k5kn5 min c``t kv alpha-CoVs t2 kv d``k kiv /cv tusk k` l5kl5kn5, dux dv f66 n77xv ju2y pu]]th k` l2y tin cv moc kv jsk vmv.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Kv jvn du]p vmv, ca alpacas d22 k1m raar vn f66 j2kv HCoV-229E- min c``t kv alpha-CoV k` naath.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Kv thu]k, l5kl5kn5 v thok duel m5 n6x naath ju1th, t5t5 ju3 ji77n5, Ebola, Nipah, kv ju2y m5 csal5 Hendra.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: kv vns, /c5 naath b5 g11c vl]x vn f66 l5kl5kn5 dsp naath HCoV-229E k` kv v thivl diw.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kv thu]k, alpha-CoVs l5kl5k l`tv ala lu``k m5 te rvy rivm k` HCoV-229E, Jamvl5 tin ci2x w5c kvnv alpacan5 l`t kv ala f66 t2kv d``r k` f66 kv kvn n6x kv naath ju2ys, kv thu]k cet n5 ju2y in csal5 MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: MERS-CoV l`tv ala nyuuth m5 gsaa kv thuk duel5 l22n5 tin dsap kv ju2y k` l5kl5kn5 b5 kvnv nax k` jamvl5 tin t2 w5c k` b5 jamvl5 jv n6x naath.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Kv t11 k` f66 MERS-CoV 5 tuskv k` l5kl5kn5 ca xic n5 kv tukdv min nhiam, ca ben nysk kv x1th kv dup ti xuan t5 ca ben j2k.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Ca x1c v gsaa vn f66 l5kl5kn5 t2 kv ju2y m5 r7x k` d7rivn kv w` dv kv d66r l22n5 tin k]x k` bv t11 l22n5 k]kivn w` dsp.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: kv j1ny divn, kvnv t11 divn kvvl, kv t11 in nhskv t11 k00l kv l2y tin k]x, kvnv pualv kv wu]r kv nhial, kv kvn tin n6x kv f66 b5 l5kl5kn5 ju2y mal nax kv p0th vl]x.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Kv min d]x, MERS-CoV ca lat pu]ny jamvl5 kv ksr run5 ti xuan.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Cua cu guic v gsaa kvn jamvl5 te t2kv ju2y c5 kv juey jaa k]c k` ca m5 t2 rvy t22k` divn.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: MERS-CoV la ju2y m5 tst v n66xv k` la gvvrv rsdv m``th k` kv l2y t5t5.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Kv gu1th la jv mal a dsap kv kv p0th, b5 naath cu xuot al f66 n`k MERS-CoV kv d6pdv m5 cia te th5n n5 ciax.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Kv t11 in d]x in dsap kv naath v MERS-CoV k` jamvl5, kv t11 in te kv l2y tin cet kv ku]]n, m5 t2 t11 m5 dsap SARS-CoV-2 k` kv, k` t2kv d``k.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Cet kv ju2y l22n5 tin c``t kv ku]]n n5 beta-CoVs kv kvn tin la tuk ju1th vms k` l2y t]t].

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: B5 ka kvn tin n66x kv li11 in jsak k` SARS-CoV-2- min c``t kv beta-CoVs, c`tv kv l2y tin c``t kv nyaawn5 kv jek in ca jekn5 SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Kv dup t5 nyin xuan t5 guvc kv kv d6p in dsap kv SARS-CoV-2 k` d66r l22n5 kv n7x dv naath, ba xu]t divn yian rvcs kiv raar kv g6r x`c` ms b5 bens.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kv nhiam kv kvn tin jek kv ju1th dial tin c``t kv SARS-CoV-2 ca kv xic b` cet kv SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Naath nyuak kv tek divn gu1th kv l5kl5kn5 gu1thn5 tin n11k kv l2y thin kvnv tin gu1th miim.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Di]k divn, cet kv min ca ny`l nhials, mat kvnv d6p ju1th n5 SARS-CoV-2 bv t2 k` d7r l22n5 min di]k divn min ci w` te kvvl kv l5kl5kn5 kvnv l2y tin c``t ku]]n.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Xuotv kv m5 g6r kv l2y in tusk SARS-CoV-2 k` jv.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Kv ku5c in d]x, l2y t5 g66l tin te kv bun, dup d1x di]k tin d5t tin n66x kv ju2y de guic b` vn f66 d2 CoVs j2k v thi1k kv w` dv gu1th n5 tin t2 d66r l22n5 t]t] th5n.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Min nhiam divn, t11 in la RNA rsdv a ger kv jv k` kv.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: M5 p``r5 t11 in la ju2y RNA kvl v te jv, b5 p2k c1r in car kv CoVs ba guic ala f66 “t22 piny” kiv “tee nhial” kv p2k m5 gvvr t11 ~10-4 gvvrv rs kv ru]n kv gu1th rvw, kue t2 kv t11 in te kv CoV in w2n kvnv n77xdv kv min pay tusk.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoVs ca x1c b` vn f66 la cothv tin ji`k tin bee k` jv, vn cu]th k` t]t] la nyuoth g00rv m5 d55t vl]x m5 la n77x nyu1n kiv thivl lu`x`.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Min gsaa vl]x, v f66 lu2x m5 c`t kv Remdesivir ca x1c vn f66 juocv CoV kv f66 cv rs b5 lusc kv t11 dv in gaxv f66 derv l5w kvnv RNA in g77r lu`k kv RNA in la rs dv a loc.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Remdesivir v jvn kvl m5 kua x1c p1ny vn f66 gaxv anti-SARS-CoV-2 kv them in ca thvm jv duel5 wal.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: C`x v jvn 5ns, pek mut22cin` CoVs kvn kv bathdssr5 t5 xuan k` tin la nyin l00 in t22 pu11ny.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Nysk, pek mut22cin` jvn d55tv k` CoVs m5 /k1nv x5c v pu]ny l00 in ciexv th5n.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Kv p``rv kvn SARS0CoV in te kv pek mut22con` min d55t, vn pek mut22cin` SARS-CoV-2 kuiyv n5 jvn, k` pek in x5c pu]n ranv jv.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Divwdv cet ca jv x5c n5 wen v ley d]divn m5 thieek kv raan.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Kvvl kv jvn SARS-CoV-2, jvn b` copv MERS-CoV in ca xic v gsaa v jamvl in b7m kvl.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Kv min lat kv, jscv cet kv m5 bv bu]m vn f66 ba w`lv jek vn kiv antibayrsl k66rv vn SARS-CoV2 v gsaa kv p0th.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Rvwdv vn f66 vn RNAgensme in d55t k` CoVs n77xv pil1thtithvt5 k` g2r gensme kv ku5c mut22cin5 kvnnnysak m`tdivn, ins reepv thi1k k` f66 b5 kvn tusk kvvl , vns v gssy k` f66 ba CoVs mat kvn m5 cv rs lot.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Jvn lu1k jv ku2n in rvl rs kv t11 kuen` min f66x kvn ciaax protein tin cv g1k kv guut gensmen5 d1x 3.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Di]]kdivn, CoVs la kv ciaaxdivn v gvvr kv p0th kv n5n RNA tin locv rs kv kv kv rvi c`p`p kspvk` m5 rvl rs.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Rvi l00 in l`t v la gu11th in lissm kvn rs th5n, g2r yithtvr00n` la tusskv kv gu1th kv n5n tu1n5thk5r5pcin` RNA CoV.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: Kv gu11th m5 b``r kv c11t k` kvn th11x gensmenikn5 RNAn5 la nysakv rs m``tn5 k` ba CoVs t5 pay tusk cak.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Thu]k kv ciaax gvnvtik` kv c1k in ca cak nysak m1tdivn ca jv jek k` kvn d1x rvw; HCoV-HKU1 kvn HCoV-OC43, kvvl kv CoVs leeyn5 cet kv xap SL-CoV kvn CoV xap`.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Min tusk kam` bayr`th kvn ley in ciexv pu11nydv kv ciaax in dsap kv jv

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Min d]x kssr k` di]k tin ca lat nhial w1nv kv ku5c bayr`th`, ciaax in te kv bayr`th kvn r5th0ptsr5 l00 v kvl m5 d55t kv k` ciaax in jek kvnv rs.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: W1n vmv, ca l``r kv ku5c SARS-CoV k`p v la c``t kvl m5 nyooth jv b` vn f66 tee kv pusthvtib kv kamdivn kv ciaax in dsp kvnv rs.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Kv guur g6r` x`c` m5 ca l1t kv p``rivn v ca l0y vn SARS-CoVs raan kvn SARS-CoV xaw ca jv nvn la w22 kv p0th vn xiecdivn kv r] kv ley t5 g66l, v civk kv mut22cin k` RBD protein` S.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Kv liwdv, vn RBD rvi S protein` CoV l`tv kvvl kvn r5th0ptsr5 cellulsr k` jvn la kuany jv vl]x kv ciaax antibod5n5 l00 in cv we pu]]nydv.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: K` SARS-CoV, vn RBD in te rvi 318th v we k` 15th amino athid jssk p5ragmak` S1, in mat rs kv ACE2 ran kvvl kv r5th0ptsr5 tin coth kv bayr`th rvc.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: Vn RBD SARS-CoV t22 kv lu1x kv f66 bv r5th0ptsr5 ACE2 xic t5 nyin leeyn5 t5 g66l cet kv xap, xaw, kun du22l kvn rakuun, bv kv jak` mat kv ciaaxdivn kv bayr`th.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Kv thu]k, kv dussth amino athid 6 k`r] c5 jssc t] vn f66 kv g66l k` bayr`th ran kvn xaaw tin gu1c rvi RBD k` 4 k` kv te kv rvi k` min la mat r5th0ptsr5 mstip kv ciaax l1t k00l kv r5th0ptsr5 ACE2.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: SARS-CoV xaw t22 kv mut22cin K479N kvn S487T rvi RBD, m5 dee maar kam` kv l11t k00l k`r5th0prs5 ACE2 kvn protein ithpaak.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Kv ri`t in d]x, kvn amino athidn5 d1x rvw titi gu`cdivn derv b0c kv ciaax in dee pu]ny ranv xic bayr`th.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: gsaayv vn ba x1c vn f66 SARS-CoV-2 nyuaakv r5th0prst55 cellulsr5 kvvl kvn SARS-CoV .

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: D``k m5 30% kam` CoV-2 kvn SARS-CoV rvi bun1 S1 k` S protein nyoothv jv mat maar` k` S proteindv kvn ACE2 ran d22 jv gvr.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Vpuc, g6r x`c` m5 tst kv cryo-M cv jv nyoth vn f66 10-20 kv ciaax maar` kv jvn mat vmv v b``l kam ACE2 ran SARS-CoV S protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Jvn b` gsaayv vn f66 ba jv x1c m5 t22 kv r5t0thtsr5 tin k]x m5 derv jv g6r kv ciaax d6p SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: V p``r kv vns, HCoV-NL63b` la matv rs kvn CAE2 duxdv f66 v gu11th d]divn k` S k` jv.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: T22 kv r5th0ptsr5 HCoV t5 xuan t5 k]x, cet kv aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, kvn 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Dee kvn cu]x kv gssy xiec b` kv kvn CoVs titi k` raan kv ksr k` min ca rs dsap k` ley in ciex kvn pu]]nydv.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Kv cellulsr r5th0ptsr, min be raar kv mat kam` leeyn5 kv d6pdivn kv rs kvn HCoVs b` jvn b77thv cu]x leyn5 k]kivn jssk` min d]x kvn tin ca p2n.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: k1 wargak vmv, c5 nvy m5 c2t kv nv loc k` bok in c1kv rial5k` k` k` caa t11 m5 pay tusk in d22 lu`x ju2y vms lat th5n kv ku5 ju1thn5 tin caa x1c kvnv ju1th tin diw kv, T11 in pay b2n raar in d22 lu`x kv ju2y vms in csal5 covid-19 m22 caa j2k k` caa lat vmukt`p pusl` pu11ny in t2 k` China (Health Committee of people of the Republic of China).

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Kv pay 12, 2019, vn ju2y 2019 vn csal5 CORONAVIRUS (2019-Ncov) cuv cuu d`k piny k` cuaa cua csl5 2019 Corona virus (COVID-19), Jvn b` cuaa jv csl5 5 v ju2y m5 k`p y522 nath cu]x kiv Coronavirus 2 (SARS-COV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Jvn ju2y v csal5 COVID19 vmv v ju2y m5 pay b2n, Ku x1c da lv w2 kv m5 r22pvn5 rssdv kv ku5 x`cn5 tin kualv g7r kv ku5dv, Kv ku5c vms, t11 in d22 lu`x jv koolv w` kv m5 l1t kv jv v m``th.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: c2t kv t11 in caa k1m raar vmukt`p pusl` pu11ny (National health committee) in lu1k kv nvy tin caa k`p v COVID19 k` China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), kv c`x k` 16 k` pay kvl 2020 vw`k` c`xk` d5]k k` pay d5]k 2020 caa t11 in d22 thuk n5 ju2y vms f]n n5k` b1rsw t5 cv rsdv g0r kvkv.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Duxdv f66 vn l1tdivn b` g77rv f66 ba nysk kv rial5k` m5 guic5 buskn5 tin nyuuth naath kv ku5 COVID19 kvnv l1t dial t22 caa b2n f]n kv ku5 ju1th vmv.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Kv ku5 busk in b1rswdivn m22 k`m kv raar kv c`xk` d5]k k` pay d5]k 2020, cv lat vn f66 kvn ju1th tin caa x1c g77rv jv vn f66 baa kv mat kv dup d1x rvw tin d22 kulv k`p n5 ju2y vms cu]x kiv dup d5]k tin caa lar du22l wal c`x n5 min /th2lv ruac m5 thu[k m55 caa lat kv ku5divn.

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Dup tinn d22 k`p n5 ju2y cu]x: (1) T11 in j`l kv naath k` c52x kv naath k` Wuhan am`n5 gu`th tin th522k kv jv kiv w55 tin k]kivn tin caa Ju2y in csal5 COVID 19 rspust th5n kv nin d1x 14 t22 c5 w` (2) Ruac kv ku5 j2k` kv ram m5 caa k`p v ju2y vms csal5 SARS-COV kvn nv rvw tin caa j2k v t22 ju2y vms kv t11 in caa thvmn5 kv; (3) Vn f66 b5 j2k kv ram m5 t2kv ju2y l2th` pu1ny kvnv kivl k` Wuhan am`n5 gu`th tin th522k kv jv am`n5 w55 tin caa ju2y vmv CIVID19 repust th5ns rvy n5n5 d1x 14 v k` nyuuthn5 kv n5 x1c vgsa; (4) Vn f66 b5 w` gu1th dol` m5 t2kv ram m5 caa x1c th5n vn f66 t22 kv ju2y vms kv f66 caa x1c vn f66 t22kv nyuuthn5 t5 c5 jssc k`jv rvy juskn5 d1x rvw t5 caa nvn c52x, mukt`p am`n5 class du22l g[r`.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Dup tin caa nyoth du22l wal: (1) L2th pu11ny kiv nyuuthn5 bvc` lsac, (2) kv ku5 ju1thin csal5 COVID-19 kiv k`p dv kv naath (3) Jvn rivm in b7r laa jaa gu0c kv v laa f66 /th2lv m5 tusk th5n m5 la rivk, vn f66 d2rv rsdv xok kiv d2rv rs r2p.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Vn f66 b5 naath l`t kv ku5 ju1thin c5 raan k`p t22 k` t11 in caa x`cn5 f66 cv k`p raan baa dvy ju1thn5 tin d22 ju2y vms n66x cuu guic c2t kv mv caa lat pinyv: (1) Gu1thin r]x th2m PCR kv ku5 ju1thin csal5 SAR-COV-2 (2) Jvn t11 in w2 kv jv vn ju2y nyuthv ksn d``k in x1c kv n5 ju2y vms; (3) Min thu]k kv ku5 IGM dvy ju1thn5 tin gax kv pu]ny kv ju2y in csal5 SARS-COV-2specific IGM b2ndv kv m5 bax w22 k` m5 thu]k, Jvn p2k I lu1xkv ju2y vms th5n v jvn p2k in thu]k.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: G77r nvyv vn f66 b1kv gu11thin r]x kv ku5 Th22m` n5 PCR min th0m kv lsc kvnv rivm caa mat k` bok in caa k1m raar min rvwdv kv (c`xk` 18, k` Pay kvl, 2020 kvnv c`x k` 22, k` pay kvl 2020).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Kvn tin l1t kv v nvy tin g6r kv f66 d22 ju2y vms joc 5d5 w2kv w2 nhiam kv f66 baa t11 in d22 ju2y vms jock kv jv x1c d22 lscran thvm kvnv rivm kv f66 d22 dvy ju1thn5 tin ny522ny kv pu[ny cuu x1c.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Vn pekdivn kuv gu`c k` w55, Th22mn5 k]kivn kv pek lieth (CFR), m5 nyooth pvrthn in ca thvm tin c5 l5w kv jvn juey kvn pek lieth kv jvn luex (IFR), min nyoothpvrthvn nath tin (ca thvm kvn tin /k1n thvm) tin c5 l5w kv jvn juey.

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.

R2p ju1th kv rs derv pneumonia n66x, nyuuthn5 ju1th l55k` tin be kv p0th, musn thvptik kv li11.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Gu11th in la malv tusskv jv (thaak kam` tuk` luex` kvn tuk nyuuthn5) la t22 k` n5n 14, min d5t n5 jvn la malv t22 k` n5n dhieec. Ala c``t kv thil x`th`, m1r th1x nathn5 tin te kv COVID-19 tin c5 xu1cdivn thil cua jv jek v 30% k` kv jsak cuv ben pvn k` 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Th11x thuk` kv ciaax in la thi`y ju1th fsaa v reep xot kv ba kv kulv jek.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Vn juey x1th jv t`mv vn f66 la dhi`yv rvi fsaa kv thieek kam` nath kvn pusw-pussw tin tivvtn5 tin la tussk m5 c5 ran thiam, kiv cv kivl kiv min ruac raan; thieek in d55t v f66 m5 cv la 1 v we k` 2 kv theem m5t5r kiv (k11th 3 t5 6).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: C6 g6r x`c` jv nyoth 5 kivl in /k1n kum la pusw-pussw v jak` r`th k` m5t5r5 t5 4.5 (k11th 15) v we k` m5t5r5 t5 8.2 (k11th t5 27).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Larr th11x nathv b` 5 vn bayr`th derv tek rvi pusw-pusswn5 tin te rvi jsam kv gu11th m5 b``r, tin la be raar kv gu11th in ruac raan. Pusw-pussw lr55k` dee kv tussk b` kv gu11th in yi22 raan, kvvl kv min ruac raan c`x ms vn bayr`th vmv /cv rs daprvi jsam.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Kuumv China cv lar 5 dspdv k` c`th v we thok vn SARS-CoV-2 thilv jv. Vn bayr`th la d5t dspdv kv naath kv gu11th n5n5 d1x di]k tin nhiam tin pay nyuuthn5 kv tussk kv jv, c`x min la xotv dspv naath kv gu11th in /ken nyuuthn5 kv n5 jssc kvn gu11th in jsak b`.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Vn mukt`p g1x ju1th kvn k`pdv cu]x k` Yursp (ECDC) cv jv lar 5 c`x ms /cv jsc v gsaays vn du]]p in kith kueyv piny, ran kvl derv naath d1x rvw v ew k` di]k dsp. Vn bayr`th la tekv pu]]ny du]]r` m5 cv nyuur th5n kv thaakn5 kiv n5n.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Nyuuth ksrsnabayr`th l55k` tin d5t (SARS-COV-2) v juey bayr`th in rvl rs, m22 n0n kv kv nhiam k` naath d1x di]k t5 te kv pneumonia m5 cv mat kvjuey l55k` min rup-rup 2 tussk k` Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Civx ju1th SARS-CoV-2 in rvl rs diaal tussk kvn k` bayr`thn5 tin k]x tin c``t kv jv n5 c`k`. Raar pu11ny ran vn bayr`th derv l5w kv thaabuuny, in la ysst kuumdv min gax jv. SARS-CoV-2 c``tv kvn SARS-CoV 2 nhiam.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Ca jv diw 5 t22 kv tuk k` ley.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Theem tuk` c`k` nyoothv jv 5 ksrsnabayr`th tuk`dv thieekv kvn j5nuth Betaksrsnabayr`th, k` d``k bun` Tharbeksrsnabayr`th (keer B) kvvl kv rvew tin b` k` xap.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: P``r gensme kvvliwdv a m`n5 walv cv jv jek 5 92% k` tuk` c`k` min mat ksrsnabayr`th gumputhv kvn SARS-CoV-2, m5 nyooth jv 5 gumputh/cv der a jvn la ramin tusskv k` jv ms.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Min ca thvm la b22 raar kv ksr thaakn5 kiv n5n.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: C11p tin dee gax d6p luex` ju1th kv kvn yoop civvx` pusl` pu11ny ran kv rs kvvliw, l1k tetn5, g1x thiex wax kiv wum kv thok kv tet t5 /k1n lak kvn kivl kiv thiax rvi wargak` kv f66 vn wargak vms ba dhil ku2x gu11th t]w` ji`kn5.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.

Naath tin l11t du22lwal tin d]x cv thi11xkivn k`p kv juey ca kv l1r f66 b5 kvn tiit k1n, kv tiit kv du]]p in r7m kv kv kv naath tin k]x, kvn g1x wax. Ciaax jek` nath v kvvl m5 bum kv ciaax j5 lu`x` pusl` pu11ny kv f66 ba gu11th in tussk kv luex x1c k` ba wedv nhiam gax.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Kvn naath tinn l`t kv jv dee kvn l``r v jek m5 c5 kv thi22k kv naath ca thvm k` ca jek 5 te kv juey COVID-19. K1p l``r5 v ji`k cv fsw thi`x t`mv kv ciaax in d22 gax luex; cet kv thu]ny wu]m kvn ks1k r66l /c5 kv we kv gu11thdivn.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: Vn CDC cv jv lar 5 m5ca COVID-19 diw kiv caa jv x`th k` raan gu11th l1t cet kv mukt`p, gu11th pussk`, gu1th nyuur` nath diaal, k` elvktsrsnik m5 nyuakv cet kv tablvt, yithk5r5n in la gu22r kv, kv ATM maciin m5 ca k`p v ram te kv juey, ba luexdv dhil n`k.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: M5 cv bu]m vn f66 ba juey t]w kv thi1xsv kv fsw, la jv a f]1n kv vn f66 b5 naath we k` ciaax ji``k cet kv du`c: Kvn c11p titi la kv a l1t kv f66 ba thi1x ju1th kv piny jak` kuiy k` t5 ji``kdv ku00 k` ciaax pusl` pu11ny rvi wec.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.

Kv gu11th m5 cet kv 2 pay xuaan, pek m5 thieek kv bathdssr5 t5 300 kv naath kiv 90%, cu kvn ciex rvi g`k` wec k` Yunaytet Yitht22t, pek m5 b``l bathdssr5 t5 50 cu kvn te rvi g`k` wec k` Pilipay, k` pek m5 we k` naath t5 bathdssr5 t5 59 cu kv ciex rvi g`k` wec k` Thsth Apirka, k` cu pek m5 bathdssr5 t5 1.3 te rvi g`k` wec k` India.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
