sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Kv ku5c vms, cu kuumv te kv b0l kv f66 thilv jv du]]r m5 cv l1t kv ku5c nvvn5 kv kv ciaax in d22 gax juey kvn min divvr kv naath. Kv 16 pay di]k cu ku`` Piraaminthvt, Borith Johnthon jv lar 5 ba j`l diaal tin nyu]n-nyu]]n p`l kv jek nath, laarv jv 5 b5 naath l`t ci22xn5kivn m5 lotv rs k` ba tiec cet kv gu1th ksaaxn5 p`l, du2l kuan, kvn gu1th x11r5 tuaar5.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Kv 20 pay di]k, cu kuumv kv lar 5 gu11th x11r5 tvth` lsaac diaal cet kv gu11th ksaaxn5 kvn gu11th p55m`v kv g1kv kv p0th m5 lotv rs, k` cuv jv yac vn f66 ba 80% k` l11t moc yi7u kv pek m5 cet kv 2500 kv pay kv g1x k` f66 b5 l`t thil rvi rik`. kv 23 pay di]k,Piraaminthvr jv lat 5 b5 naath dhilv cux kiv nur kv kam, laarv jv 5 thil bu]m m5 b``l naath d1x rvw t5 b5 nyuur kvvl k` thilv ram j`l rvi car lsr` baax m5 ba nvn.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: V c5 cet kv c11p t22 wen, cua kvn c11p t5 pay lar t5 l1th l`t v boolith kv mu]c nath karamn5 kvn juc nath t5 dusl kv rs.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Kv 23 pay kvl, kv luc nath kv min ca l1 v kuumv min d55t kv g1kdv kv j`l rvi Wuhan, cu ram in l`t k` WHO n5 Gauden Galea jv lar 5 c`x min /c5 ri`t m5 be k` WHO, jvn b` gsaayv vn f66 ca c1p vms l1t kv f66 ba thi1x ju1th kv fsw t]w vn gu11th vmv in cv d5t th5n k` cuv jv csl 5 v m5 /c5 rs b5 nysk k` ciaax pusl` pu11ny nath diaal. kv 30 pay kvl, kv ksr k` m22 cop lssc nath vn f66 vn juey dsp raanv k` ram in d]x raar wec china kvn r2p ju1th kv rs w55n5 tin k]x, cu WHO jv lar 5 ca rivk pusl` pu11ny nath diaal m5 diir fsw kvvliw (PHIC), v PHIC min xuaandivn v tookv k` c11p t22 tussk kv nhiam kv ru]]n 2009 kv Yithwan p5luu 2 thi``x fsw.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".

Kv 25 pay rvw, cu WHO jv lar 5 vn wec mu]]n g77rv jv 5 bv rs rial5k` v gssa kv ku5c d`k` ju1th ksrsnabayr`th vmv rvi fsaa, laarv jv 5 c`x ms xotv gu11th in d22 jv csl kv jv ms 5 v juey m5 c5 fsw kith, kvn w55 dhilv jv g7r v thu]k vn f66 b5 kv rs rial5k`.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: Th2m lab kv juey ksrsnabayr`th 2019 l55k` (COVID-19) kvn SARS-CoV-2 bayr`th in c``t kv jv mat jv kv du]]p in d22 jek t11 bayr`th` th5n kvn naath tin jek antibod5n5 tin tussk kv ku5c k66r luex`.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).

sourceString: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
targetString: Yunaytet Kixdsm b` cuv c1p th2m l1t kv 23 pay kvl 2020. Cu ksmpan5 Thsth Korea m5 csal5 Kogenebiot0k du]]r l1t n5 kiliniksl g5r22d, PCR kv jek SARS-CoV-2 (Lu1x guec ksrsnabayr`th) kv 28 pay kvl 2020.

sourceString: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.

K` china, cu bu]n BGI a jvn bu]n in nhiam in k` ksmpanvn5 m22 ca jak` l`t kv ku5c kuakn5 tin ru]p-ru]]p tin nyin PCR kv SARS-CoV-2 v kuumv china tin n0n kv juey. k` Yunaytet Y5tht22t mukt`p g1x ju1th kvn k`p cu]x ju1th (CDC) d``kv kuak th2m kv thaakn5 tin thu]]k kv 2019 ksrsnabayr`th in rvl rs (2019-nCoV) RT-PCR kv pvnal th2m kv ciaax pusl` pu11ny k` lab kv r5ajvn wec mu]]n kvvliw k` kuak.

sourceString: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.

sourceString: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.

Kv 13 pay di]k 2020, gu11th th2m Roche cuv x`th jek k` FDA kv ku5c th2m m5 d22 thuk rvi thaakn5 t5 3.5 kv pek in d55t, m5 jak maciin kvl k` thvm naath t5 p``r kv 4,128 rvi thaakn5 t5 24.

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

sourceString: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.

Th2m in we kv msnskslsnsl antibod5 min la mat rs kvn n7skiliskapthid pretein (N preotein) ksrsnabayr`th in rvl rs min l1t kv k` Taiwan, kv guec k` f66 bv min ca thvm v be raar kv minitn5 15 v we k` 20 cet th2m yinpiluvndha in la p0th.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: L1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny ciax kv gu11th in te rivk th5n kv c`x d``r gaxv thi1x ju1th kv hsw kv` ju1th t5 xuan, c``t c5th kvn kslsra, tin la dsap kv kv kam thusk kvn c`th.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: Deed naath lu00x b` kv juey l55k` cet kv enpiluvndh kiv thony-thony, c``t, m5 /ken naath tetkivn lak v xot /ken kvn w`xkivn gu22r, wumkivn, kiv thukivn (v la kv gu1th tin h]]c).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Gu1th di]k tin ji`k tin d5t kv c`c d``r kv gu11th in gsaa kv l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny kvn tin: kv ksr k` m5 c5 raan we kaayn5 kiv v xot /ken5 n5 we kaayn5, kv ksr r`c` thar gat` kiv g2r gat` kv daypvr, v xot /ken5 gatn5 lu22th, v xot /ken5 n5 m5th v xot /ken5 ku`n thal kiv kv ksr th1t ku1nkiv k`p ri`x m5 /ken tuak, r`c kiv r5x manp0l00k.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Kv ksr thuny` wu]m, kivl kiv thiam.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Kv ksr k` m5 c5 ley gu22r, c5 ley moc mieth, kiv c5 ley r`c.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: Ciaax yup` tetn5 kv ciaax du22lwal lotv n5 guur civx` yoop` min ca lar du22lwal.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: L1k tetn5 v xot /k1n wal th6p liv yoop civvx` du22lwal derv thi`y ju1th rvi fsaa jak` kuiy kiv derv juy jak` dak.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: Min lot du2lwalv kv l1k tetn5 v f66 ba pathsj5n in c5 tet thi`x woc (bakt55rian5, bayr`thn5, kivdvy ju1thn5 tin k]c tin /ca guic kv wax tin d22 rivk ju1th n66x ) kvn kvm5k]l5 tin d22 juey n66x.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Vns gsaayv kv naath tin l`t kuan kiv tin l`t du11lwal, jvn b` derv gsaa kv ciaax pusl` pu11ny kvvliw k` naath diaal.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: L1k tetn5 t22 kv ciaax gsyn5 pusl` pu11ny, cet kv xu]kdv kv yinpiluvndha, ksrsnabayr`th, kvv kv ju1th tin k]kivn; gaxv luex ju1thn5 c5th`, gaxv ju1th l55k` tin la kuuk li11k;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: k` xookv pek lieth gan rvi tin dap kv ci22xn5.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: G6r x`c` m5 ca l1t kv 2013 nyoothv jv 5 ciaax l1k tetn5 derv naath nax k` gssy civvx` m5 tst kv ciaax pieth gat` m5 xot run kv k` /k`n dhieec n5 b`l.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop v gsaa, li11 gaat` tin la a n77x ju1thy l55k` kvn ju1th c5th` d22 kv xok kv l`th civxn5 t5 thi1k-thi11k l`t, cet kv l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Vn l1t v thi1k-thi1k vmv derv li11 ju1thn5 titi xok kv 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: L`t tin kap l1k tetn5 nhial d22 kvn locn5 ju1thn5 c5th` xok k` di]]k, k` jvn p``rv kv n66x p55n5 t5 gsw k` naath tin ciex gu11th m5 kuiy kuakv.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 48% k` xu]k locn5 ju1th c5th` kv rs derv ben kv t11 civvx` l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny th5n. L1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny v jvn kvl in nhiam k` bum k` v jvn du]]p in thi1k kv g1x ju1thn5 c5th` kvn ju1th l55k` tin be v rup-rup (ARI), cet kv civx tin l1t kv v la civx ci2x, du22lg]r`, kvn rvi wec kvvliw.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Pneumonia, juey in nhiam k` ARI, v jvn kvl in la n77x li11 k` gaat tin xot /ken runkivn dhieec cop, min nax t2k nvvn5 t5 bathdssr5 t5 1.8 kv ru]]n kvl.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: C5th kvn pneumonia kvvl k``p kvn pek m5 cet kv bathdssr5 t5 3.5 k` li11 gan kv ru]]n.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: Cet kv m22 ca lar v UNICF, we nath k` l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny v xot /ken raan m5th kiv kv ksr ben` ran du22l coown5 gu11th m5 te kv diw derv t1k nath t5 xuan lu`k v b``l w`l g1x ju1th kiv ciaax g1x du22lwal, xookv l5th kv kv nuth kv ju1th luex` l55k` tin ru]p-ru]]p kv kuvtvr kvl.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: L1k tetn5 gu1thn5 t5 xuan la mat jv kvvl kvn civx yoop` k]kivn t5 t] nyin p55n5, ciaax yoop` kvn psrg5r``mn5 g1x ju1th (WASH).

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: L1k tetn5 b` gaxv luex gup` k` gaat min la dsap kv gu22r nath kv pu1nykivn.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Kvl m5 tst m5 dee tussk kv d5t l1k tetn5 n5 vn t`mv la n77xv k66t gup` m5 dee ji``kdv n77x.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: G6r x`c` m5 ca l1t k` Denmark kv 2012 cv jv jek 5 l1k tetn5 m5 d55t la n77xv kuuk, kuac k` gu]p in csal 5 vcdhvma kiv juey gup`, min la d5t k` l11t du22lwal.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: L1k tetn5 m5 d55t ca jv nvn b` v la kvl k` nyuuthn5 civvx` m5 jut-jut in csal 5 (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: T22 kv dup dhieec t5 g77r tiit kv c`x d``r kv min laak naath tetkivn kv thhaabuuny kv ciaax xuk` ju1th: kv ksr ben` ran raar du22l coown5 (we coown5 kvn we dssr), kv ksr r`c` thar gat` (g2r daypvr`), v xot /ken5 gat n5 lu22th kv th5n, v xot /ken5 m5th kiv kv kst th1t ku1n kiv m5 c5 r5x m5 /ken tuak gu22r, r`c kiv r5x manp0l00k.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Gu1th tin k]x tin gsaa l1k tetn5 th5n kv f66 d22 jv l1t kv ciaax g1x d7p ju1th kvn tin, v f66 b5 raan bu]t kiv t2p jak` thil nivt; kv ksr thiam`, kv ksr kil` kiv kv ksr thuny` wu]m kv ksr gu22r` l==, kvn ksr gu22r` ju`kn5 tin ca y1k.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Rvi w55n5 t5 xuan, l1k tetn5 kuiyv.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: G6r x`c` kv ciaax l1k tetn5 rvi w55n5 t5 54 kv ru]]n 2015 cv jv lar 5 pek m5 cet kv 38.7 k` j5 ci22xn5 guur kvn l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny. K` g6r x`c` kvl kv ru]]n 2014 nyoothv jv 5 Thsd5 Arabia v jvn te kv pek m5 d55ts m5 97 pvrthvn; Yunaytet Y5tht22t t22 kv pek m5 77 pvrthvn; k` te china kv kv pek m5 kuiy m5 p``r kv 23 pvrthvn. C11p t5 xuan t5 g00r kv ciaax kv t`mv te kv th5n kv rep civvx` l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny kv gu11th in bcv ciaax. Bu]n kv ciaax l1k tetn5 k` gaat du22lg]r` kv gu11th in ca mat kv rvi c1x kvl v du]]p kvl rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop kv rep civvx` l1k tetn5 kv ciaax gan.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: Psrg5r11m in gsaa kv ciaax yoop` pusl` pu11ny in ca l1th l`t v mukt`p du22lg]r` k` Pilipay v c``t kvl kv ciaax l1t kv kap nhial pusl` pu11ny gan kvn ciaax ju22lg]r`.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Juc wom` k` rvvwkv ru]]n, v gu0l kv kv l1k tetn5 ciax kv thaabuuny, tu]th lvc ciax kv pslsraay, d5tv k` jvn psrg5r11m wec vms.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Jvn b` ca l1th l`t v gsaa kv k` Indon5cia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Wu]c rvyn5 ju1thn5 jssk gup` la l1t jv kv mat thaabuuny` h5n kiv yintvrjvnn5 k` p5w.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Vn l1t thaabuuny` min d55t kvn yintvrjvn v f66 bv rik xok kv jek du]p, k` bv jek du]p rep.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: P5w k`r] kvn thil kv l1t m5 com kv yoop kv f66 thisl kvn protein5, tin la srganikn5 mu]]n /c5 kvn la be rasr kv p5w.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Ciaax yoop`, kuv la f66 jvn la lu1k jv kv xuan p55n5 kv gu11thdv..

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Thaabuuny in del-del kv ku5c ciaaxdv min thu]k, derv bakt55rian5 tin ca jek kv gu11th 2 nhiam.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: G6r x`c` t5 tst t5 ca f]n t5 ca d6p bakt55ria guic t5 jekv k` thaabuuny m5 c5 ji``k kv nivt ca jv nvn cetv t11 bakt55riak` min wen in ca nhiac piny kv gu]p thaabuuny`.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: Vn CDC xotv larv jv 5 thaabuuny in law-law gsan5 jvn kv l1k tetn5.

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Thaabuuny antibakt5rial cv jv kap nhial vl]x kv ciaax pual` pu11ny k` naath.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: V be n5 k` walv, thilv m5 nyooth f66 l1t ran kv ant5thvptikn5 kiv nyin wuc` luex` tin ca lar 5 d22 antibaystikn5 liny kv ciaax dvvn5 ju1th tin /ca guic.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Kuv la f66 thaabuunyb5 antibakt5rial te rvidv kv ant5bakt5rial5 t5 cet kv t5r5kslthan, min te rvidv kv j=dvy ju1thn5 t5 xuan tin la ant5bakt5ria v ruut.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: %ns, c`x /k1n ant5baystikn5 kv ru]]t thaabuuny` min te rvidv kv antibaystik kv kuany, derv tussk vn f66 /c5 kv dee l`t kv gu11thdivn cet kv min ca lar.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Nysk vn thvrpaktan kvn dux g1x gup`, vn thsp5tht5k2tvt pormul22cin dee rvidv te kv athidn5 (athvtik athid, athksrbik athid, laktik athid) cet kv g``x PH, ant5mayksrsbial5 athid bvnvdhsa in t2k kv ksnd5cinvr gup` (alsy bvra, baytamin, menthsl, kv 0kt0rvkn5 jivn.) Guec kvvl m5 gsaa m5 ca l1t k` Yunib7thvt5 Oregon du22lg]r` pusl` pu11nycvjv nyoth vn f66thaabuuny baax gsayv v cetv kv thaabuuny ksnthi77mvr g5r22d ant5bakt5ria min te rvidv kv t5r5kslsthan kv g1x ju1th kvn wu]c bakt5rian5 tet` ran.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: P5 t5 l2th-l22th tin gsaa kv l1k tetn5 ran c5 kvn v leth vl]x v d22 bakt5ria n`k.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Bakt5ria jvn la pithv kv p0th vl]x rvi jsam pu11ny (37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Kuv la f66 p5 t5 musr-mussr, p5 thaabuuny` gswn5 kvn v m``th k` p5 t5 ks1c-ks11c, p5 thaabuuny tin la lak kv mun baax in la k``p mun kvnv bakt5ria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: V gu1c kv jvn du]]p v ca x`thv n5 wen, taanyt5thn5 c5 kvn v lar l1k nath kv p5 t5 mor thilv m5 lu`kv naath kv xu]kdvkv.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Vn than5taydhvr l1k tetn5 kiv antithvpik jvn v dux cu]th teten5 m5/c5 p5w g6r.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Kv guut ruun` 1990 kvn tuk ruun` 21th thvncuvr5, alksl in la custh kv tet v thil p5w kvvl kvn w`l pusl` pu11ny ajvn (min la csal kv b` 5 alksl cu]th tetn5 min /c5 p5w g7r, ant5thvpik kiv than5taydhvr) cu kv te kv gssy m5 d55t.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: R5wdivn kv t5 l`t kvithspropaal alksl ithansl t5 l1t kv kvvl kv ajvn in la jak` kv k` thivk cet kv carbomvr (psl5mvr athaykilik athid) ba kv l1th rvi jeel`, kiv hum5kan cet kv g5laythvr55n rvi k` t5 law-laaw, kiv gu]p thaabuuny` kv f66 b5 th1t kv kv thi1k k` bv k66t alksl` gax.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Mat h`ydsrsj5n per-skthaad in ca lism reepv l1t ant5mayksrsbial vl]x. Than5taydhvr tetn5 te rvidv kv alksl m5 tst m5 we k` 60 v we k` 95% k` r6x kv kv n`k dvyn5 ju1th tin n11k.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Alksl in la custh kv tetn5 n`k kvn bakt5riaa, bakt5rian5 tin la ruut wal t5 xuan (MARSA kvn VRE), t5b5, kvvl kv th11x bayr`thn5 (kvvl kv HIV herpith, RSV, rayn66bayr`th, bakth5nia, yinpiluvndha kv hepvtait5th) kv p1xgay.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Than5taydhvr5 alksl` tin la custh kv tet tet rvidivn kv 70% alksl m5 n`k 99.97% (3.5 kv xu]k, m5 c``t xu]kdv kv 35 dvth5bvl) kv bakt5ria jssk tetn5 kv thvkvn5 kv ksr l`th`dv kvn 99.99% v we k` 99.999% (4 v we k` lsgn5 5 kv xu]k dvyn5 ju1th) bakt5ria k` tet kv minit 1 kv xu]kdivn. Than5taydhvr l1k tetn5 kvn gsw kv kv n`k th11x bayr`thn5.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Tan5taydhver alksl` l1k tetn5 kvn thilv kv lust m5 com k` k7rivn kv nsrsbayr`th (kiv Norwalk) ci2x man bayr`th, in d5t in la n77x ju1th jivc tin la dsp naath. Anitthvptik tetn5 m5 r7x kiv alksl ba jv dhil custh tetn5kivn v ba tet jak` h]c kvn d1x rvw kvvl.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Rvi tetn5 kv jskdivn kvvl kv kam yivtn5 g77r kvn cu]th kv thvkvn5 t5 30 am`n5 m5 thi11x kv jel kiv gu]p v cv lv k66t.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: W5c yivn5 ba kv dhil lak v gsaa b`, ba kv custh rvi tetn5. Vn mukt`p g1x ju1th kvn k`pdv cu]]x k` US cv jv lar 5 l1k tetn5 kvvl kv cu]thdivn kv tan5taydhvr, kv gu11th in c5 raanv nvn 5 c5 tet kv lsth.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Vn ciaax v c5 d5t kv k`n ajvn5 titit kv jv ms n77xv thi`k k`n5divn kvn n`kdivn kv dvy ju1th kv p0th, kv la f66 kvn /ca kv b5 guic 5 kv t5 ca gvr ciaax l1k tetn5 min gsaa vn5 m5 c5 thaabuuny thil kvn p5w.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Vn f66 dee raan tet kv cua coth kv than5taydhvr alksl n5 vn t`mv jvn la n77xv dee gu]]p ran k66t vn5 m5 te raan kv emslivnn5 kiv ca kv mat kv nyin g1x k77t gup`.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Vn k66t gup` min tussk kv k`n than5taydhvr` m5 d55t d22 jv xok kiv d22 jv wu]th piny m5 ca g5layth5r55n mat th5n kiv emsl55n d]divn.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: K` ciaax f]1n wal rvi du22lwal, thanvtaydhvr5 alksl tin lak kv tet tin te rvidivn kv emsl55n m5 kuiy rivkdivn kvn kuukdivn k` thaabuuny kiv ant5mayksrsbial detergent.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Kuuk kv gu22r gup`, guur nyuuthn5 yurt5karia kiv haypvrthvnth5b5l5t5 kv alksl kiv tin k]x tin ca mat th5n rvi alksl` l1k tetn5 la tusskv v dak.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Ciaax yuth` pivny kuuk` gup` cv ben du]]p kvl k` p``r thaabuuny` kv l1k tetn5 kv p5w.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: P`lv gssydivn, ajvn5 tin thil p5w t5 g77r kvn kv kvn /ca yoop tetn5 jak` we kv gu11thdv k` kauk srganik, duxdv f66 kvn wusc kv luex.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: V jvn ku5c vms vns jak kvn than5taydhvr5 tetn5 k` f66 b5 kv thil lust m5 d55ts kv g1x dvvn5 ju1th pathsj5n, kv f66 kvn pathsj55n5 la xot kv jssk tetn5.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Gssy than5taydhvr5 tetn5 tin thil alksl naxv rs kv tin diaal tin ca liam th5n n5 kv t1thdivn, k` kv min la l0x kv jvn t22 kv alksl m5 kuiy kvn alksl in la custh kv tet.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Kv jvn gu11th v thi1kv, l1t wal tin l`t kv bendhalksnivm kslsraad cv jv nyu]th vn f66 t22 kv j1ny antimayksrsbial m5 la j`ny kv ksr k` m5 ca jv kuex, v /cv cet lv alksl, in c5 jssc vn f66 la xookv gssydv kv ksr k` min ca nyi66k kv l`th d]x kv f66 derv ciaax k77t` gup` n66x.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Naath t5 xuan rvi w55n5 tin dak kuakivn kvn /ca k6k thaabuuny` lu`x k` kvn la kvn k`n5 x0th kvn mun.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: X0th kiv mun jvn derv gsaa b` k` p5w k`r] m5 thil thaabuuny, duxdv f66 jvn l`ny thaabuunyv vl]x.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Kvl m5 diir naath mun kiv x0th jvn b` te rvidv kv luex kv dvy ju1thn5 jvn derv luex rep k` f66 derv xok n5 jv.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Cet kv thaabuuny, x0th b` jvn derv dvy ju1th n`k kv f66 min cv rs gu22r kvn p5w, la n77xv alk5laany thulucin.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO cvjv lar 5 x0th kiv livt cet kv du]]p in d]x in dee naath lu`k m5 thilv thaabuuny.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: L1k tetn5 kv du]]p m5 gsaa ca jv lar v mukt`p g1x ju1th kvn v k`p cu]xdv k` US jvn dup kv kvn tin:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Jak tetku k` f]c kv p5w t5 mor kiv p4w t5 rix.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: P5w t5 rix ca kv lar vn f66 gsw kv kv f66 p5w tin c5 cu]x d]x derv tussk 5 c5 kv lu00x, duxdv f66 leth kiv k]1cdivn derv tussk 5 thilv jv d``k.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Cu]th tetn5 kv kv gu]p kv thaabuuny m5 r7x , kvvl kv am`n5 jskdivn, kam yivtn5 kvn rvi ri7pn5.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Thaabuuny la jivcv dvy ju1th nhial pu]]ny gup`, k` nyooth g6r x`c` jv 5 naath la lak kv tetkivn kv p0th thaabuuny v /c5 ms a p5w k`r].

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Coth kv kv thvkvn5 t5 20.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Cu]th tetn5 la n77xv p5r5cin, m5 la lu`k k`m raar dvvn5 ju1th k` gu]p, k` l1k kv gu11th m5 b``r la woocv dvy ju1th t5 xuan.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Coth tetk5 v gsaa kv p5w t5 rix.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Cu]th tetn5 kv p5 t5 c5 cu]x derv repn5 ji``k luex`.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Poc tetku kv b5y kiv k7t kv kv jism.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Tet t5 f]]c kivthi1kv vl]x vn f66 dee kv mal lu00x nysk. Gu1th tin la malv tey /ca cop v w5c yivtn5, kusc tet`, kam yivtn5, kvn rvi ri7pn5.

targetString: Ri7p tin t1th kv v raan kvn ri7p tin ca coth kv wal dee kvn te kv dvy ju1thn5 ti tek.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: L6cin in la yieer kv naath ca jv lar 5 gsaay kv g1xdv kv f66 dee gu]p k66t; gu]p m5 k66t derv ji``k gup` n66x kvl m5 dee rep luex ju1th kv rs rep.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Dup t5 xuan kv ciaax ku00k` k7k` d22 kv l1th l`t kv f66 d22 ciaax l1k tetn5 gu]]r m5 thilv p5w kvn thaabuuny, c``t tieth p55n5 k` jerk1n m5 ca xapkiv f6k m5 ca cu]th kiv l1k kv x0th m5 g77rv jv rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop v gsaa. Kv gu1th tin dak p5w th5n (cet kv du2lg]r` kiv rvi ci2x rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop v gsaa), t22 kv gu1th t5 ca p5w t]w th5n, cet kv maathuur5 p55n5 kvn civx k]kivn tin kuiy k6k kuakn5.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Vn mathuur p55n5 v t0kn6l6j5 m5 th51k-th51k m5 laa j`k v xapkv kv dep m5 ca yian k` du]]r m5 dsanykv kv c577k kv h66 bv p5w kvnv thaabuuny wusc tetn5.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: K6t tetn5 m5 r7x v du]]p yup` tetn5 m5 gsaa, duxdv h66 te xaknsm th5n k` du]]p in de naath tetkivn k7t kvjv dueel coown5.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: G6r x`c` m5 d55t m5 reeprs nyoothv jv 5 wargakn5 puc` te kv kvv yoop m5 d5t n5 jvn k` k77t tetn5 k1r1pvn5 tin te du2l5 l1k.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Kvv 2008, ca g6r x`c` l1t k` Yun5b7rth5t5 Wvthm5n5th22r k` Lsndsn m5 tusrkv y57wkv piny v yindutht5r5 wargakn5 puc` k` th5mp6dh56m j5 Yursp, kvh66 baa p``r5 l1t k` yoop in n77x wargakn5 puc` jv, k77t tetn5 m5 leth jismdv, am`n5 k77t tetn5 jsam maciin` min pay jek.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Kv ksr k` min c5 tetdu lak k` cii k7t kv k77t tetn5 jsam m5 leth, cuaa nsmbsr bakt5riaan5 kvv liw jii yivtn5 tetn5 jek v cv rs rep kv pek m5 194% kvnv pek m5 254% jic tetk`.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Kv k7t tetn5 kv k77t tetn5 jsam maciin`, ca jv jek5 nsmbsr bakt5riaan5 kvv liw jii yivtn5 tetn5 cv rs rep kv pek m5 42% kvnv pek m5 15% jic tetk`.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Kv ksr k` min c5 tetdu lak k` cii k7t kvv wargak puc`, cuaa nsmbsr bakt5riaan5 kvv liw jii yivtn5 tetn5 jek v cv rs rep kv pek m5 76% kvnv pek m5 77% jic tetk`. C5 tanyt55thn5 th2m l1t kv yivthdvpiny m5 t22 kv luex m5 n66xkv v nvy tin be dueel l1k tetn5 m5 d]x kvnv gu11th du2l l1k tetn5, m5 be kv tin k6t kv tet nath.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.

targetString: Yuupn5 tetn5 tin te rvydivn kvv alk]]l b5 rvydivn dhil te kvv alk]]l m5 60% m5 cv ku00.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: L1k tetn5 du2l w1l cu2 cu1 m5 de dhil l1t kv ksr k` m22 c5 k5m j5 H1xg1r5 lu1x l1tdv jek kvv (1846) kv g1x jsaak rvy gu1th du22l w1l.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: T22 kvv kuak vl0kt5r7nikn5 t5 la l11t du2l w1l v l`r-l`r m5 c5 kvn l1k tetn5 p1l ru22c.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: C5 g6r x`c` kvl v jek5 l1t kv kvn kuak titi cv luex yu]thpiny.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: L1k tetn5 du2l w1l l0ljv kvv thvksn5 15 v we nhiam, kv thaabuuny m5 d55t kvnv p5w kiv jivvl vwe k` gu]p thaabuuny` am`n5 cu]th tetn5 d1x rvw.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Tet baa kv dhil coth kvvl v coth yivt kamn5kivn.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: M5 te piny r57pn5 kvv nivt, d22 woc kv b5ruc m5``m.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Kv h66 dee dvy ju1thn5 xot rvy p55n5 tin te tetn5, v m5 gsaa vn h66 ba kv poc vgsaa k` baa kv poc v b5 kv k66t v wic kv puuc.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Vnvmv gaxv tet kv h66 /c5kv b5 lu00x v nysk k` gu`th t]t].

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Lust k` min lakv tet rvy du2l w1l v wu]c dvy ju1thn5 tin dee juey n66x (“dvy ju1thn5 ) kvnv pendivn we k` nvy k]kivn.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Juornal5 du2l w1l k` Ix5lvn laar kvnv 5 thivl l1k tetn5 t22 k` pek m5 /ca g7r gu`thn5 du2l5 wal t5 xuan, k` nsmbsr dsktsr5 kvnv n``thn5 m5 d55t laa l1k tetn5 v /ken kvn j5 ju1thn5 n5 gu22r v p`l ru22c, b5 dvy ju1thn5 cuu we k` nvy tin k]x.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: C5 g6r x`c` kvl v nyoth5 l1k tetn5 kv gu11dv kvnv dup t5 musny-mussny tin k]x yuthv luex rivm in n66xkv v kaltucn5 piny kv pek m5 66 p`rc`n. C5 mukt`p du2l w1l in d55t w5mu]]n wargak k1m raar m5 nyooth l1k tetn5 kvnv cu]th tetn5 min lotrs gu`thn5 du2l5 wal.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Caa wargak in ca g]r kvv nhiam v mukt`p l1th k` wvpthaayb` kv h66 b5 j5 wec c`rkivn th6p.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Caa gu`cdv vnysk in lotrs l1tv Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Theemn5 k7k` thvmkvn yu]p tetn5 k` nyooth kvn gssydv, m5 caa nyu]th guur5 xu]tn5 g7r.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Te mukt`p du2l w1l in d55t w5mu]]n kv “gu`th dhieec” t5 lakv tet:
