targetString: Kv ksr l1t m5 dee luex n66x, kvnv

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: Kv ksr yup` gu1n ju1th. Mat k0m5k]l5 t5 gax luex rvy thaabuuny` (thaabuunyn5 t5 te rvydivn kv“ w`l” kiv “m5 gax dvy ju1thn5”) th7pv n`k dvvn5 ju1thn5 k` kuak l1k tetn5.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Ciaax n1k vms d22 jv g7r kv nhiam kv ciaax k` f66 baa l2t gu]]r kiv kv gu11th in c5 antibaystikn5 jssc vn f66 ruut dvy ju1th kv k` c5 kv xuan kvn dvy ju1thn5. Kv ciaax in d22 raan tet kv coth kv gu11th in ba ciaax ret` tok, gsaayv vn f66 dee raan tek lak kv f66 bv maathuurv lvp k` bv g`k v /cv jv thiap kv tetdv, th11x kslshekth5daan kiv aysdin l1k, kvn bieyn5 tin wusc kv luex kv k66t tetn5 kv ksr l1k, kvn cuuth tetn5 kv f66 b5 kv k66t kv kuak tin k]x tin nyin g1x luex` min te piny ri7pn5.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Kuak tivkn5 civvx` diaal ba kv dhil k1m raar.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Jvn du]]p vmv g77rv l1k tetn5 kvn ju1th tetn5 v be k` ciel, ciax kv minitn5 2-6.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Cu]th kv gu11th m5 b``r (minitn5 10) thilv m5 g77rv.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Min coth5 tetku, p5w tin te ju1thn5 tetn5 ba kv dhil gax kv locdivn rvi tetn5.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Kv ksr l1k tetn5 m5 cv thu]k, ba tet coth kv kuaak m5 thil luex k` b` b5y ret` mindaan dhil l1th.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Kv g1x kiv xu]k thi`y` dvvn5 ju1th piny, gsaayv vn f66 d22 tet lak kiv d22 tet antithvptik tetn5 kv nhiam kiv kv ksr thuk` l1t raam m5 te kv juey.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Kv g1x luex` ithtapaylskskal rvi du22lwal, cv jv jek vn f66 min d55t in gsaa kv ciaax l1k tetn5 b22 kv nhiam v la 20% k` l1k, kvn f66 min tst d[divn in d22 mat th5n b22 kv l1k tetn5 ciax kv cua jv rep v b``l 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: L1k kv thaabuuny baax la n77xv luex bakt5ria kv gu1th t5 cop di]k kv ciaax in reepv rs kv jv kv kuan m5 p11r kv jv kv l1k kv thaabuuny ant5bakt5rial. M5 p``r5 cu]th tetn5 kv alksl thulucin kvn l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny bakt5rial kv thaak m5 tst m5 cet kv thvkvn5 t5 30 kvl nyoothv jv 5 alksl thaabuuny nyooth kvnv k0l-k00l55 xook kvn luex baskt5ria kv pek m5 26 m5 b``l thaabuunyantibakt5ria.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Duxdv h66 thaabuuny kvn p5w gsaan5 jvn k`alksl tetn5 kv xu]kdv kv H1N1 yinpiluvndha min la bayr`th k` kslstht5r5nivm d5p5thaal th0l5 tin jekv kv t]]c k` tet. Ciaax g1x kv rep pusl` pu11ny rvi du22lwal d22 kv rs nax kvvl kv ciaax du22lg]r` k` l11t kv l1k tetn5, jak alksl` k` t22 th5n kv cu]th tetn5, kvn wargakn5 tin ca g]1r kvn min lat kv kv thok k` l11t.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: G77rv f66 ba g6r x`c` jak` d5t kv ciaax in d22 du]]p in d22 naath lu`k kvn kv t5 gsw, v kvl m5 gsaa rvi du2l5wal.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop v gsaa, l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny cv jv guic v la m5 thil m5 d55t m5 naxv, k` gsaa kv cu]p nath kv ciaax pusl` pu11ny m5 gsaa, kv mieth kuan t5 gsw.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Kuv la f66, thil p55n5 t5 gsw, thaabuuny kiv l1k tetn5 k` naath rvi ci22xn5, rvi du22lg]r` kvn rvi gu5th in l`t naath th5n jakv jv k` bvc kv ciaax in d22 cop t11 l1k tetn5 min gsaa.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: C``t, rvi gu1thn5 t5 xuan rvi ci2x k` Apirka l1k vtetn5 kv p5 maathuur5 rvi gu1th coown5 ci2x kiv nath diaal dakv, c`x min te dup t5 thi1k th5n tin d22 nax ciaax l1k tetn5.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Kuv la f66 pek l1k tetn5 k` low land b` derv f66 jvn dakv n5 wen v /c5 ms a f66 thilv p5w kiv thaabuunyn5.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Kap nhial l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny derv tussk kv ciaax l1t th7p` c`r5, th7p l``r` kv gssy l1k tetn5 k` derv naath nax k` f66 d22 ciaaxdivn gvr v b5 l1k tet5 cu te th5n am`n5 gu11th m5 b``r.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Kv f66 dee nvmv cu we v gsaa, guur5dv kvn f66 ba naath tivt th5n dee kvn v t5 gsw.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Nysak guec kv c1p m5 gsaa kv g6r x`c` kv gu1th t5 70 t5 c5 we cv jv nvn vn f66 ciaax kv l1t k00l kv j5 wec gsaayv kv r2p civvx` l1k tetn5rvi LMICs, k` ciaax nath kv wedivn k` g`pv kuiyv. C``t kvl kv kap nhial l1k tetn5 rvi du22lg]r` v c1p kuvl5 di]k in l1t kv v UNICEF min cop du2lg]r` kv f66 ba k11th t5 thi1k-thi11k gu]]r, t5 thil m5 d55t m5 nax kv kv f66 bv jssc vn f666 c5 gaat tetkivn lak kv thaabuuny, rvi civxn5 pusl` pu11ny t5 xuan.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: M5 ca ithtvndvdn5 tin tst lu`x kv guur, vn gu2lg]r` derv cu we kv we nhiam k` c`p kuvl5 di]k.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: L`t gu1th civvx` l1k tetn5 derv la kvl k` kap nhial l1k tetn5 tin la nax kv raar kv f66 ba luex ju1th xok kvvl kvn ciaax lieth gan.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Ciaax c1x l1k tetn5 w55 mu]]n v c``t kvl kv kap nhial l1k tetn5 m5 f]n f66 ba ciaax gvr. Kv ku5c ksrsnsbayr`th` 2019-20 kv thi1xdv kv fsw, UNICEF cv k1p nath kv ciaax l1k tetn5 kv kuak macin l1th l`t.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Th11x dupn5 g7r` x`c` ca jv gic vn f66 d22 min naxv kvvliw tit vn ciaax l1k tetn5 rvi w55n5 tin /ken cop v gsaa kv f66 d22 DALYn5 gax.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Kuv la f66 nysak guec kvl cv jv lar 5 kap nhial l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny jvn t22 kv du]]r m5 d55t m5 derv nax v b``l ciaax l1k kv p5w kv ku5c yoop`.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Gssy l1k tetn5 kv ku5c pusl` pu11ny gat` ran – v civ kv ku5c nath tin thi1k rivk kv pu]nydivn cet kv man5 gan tin pay dap kiv d2cn5 tin ca moc bu]]t rvi du22lwal – n0n kv gssydv n5 kv run 19th thvncuvr5 v naath d1x rvw t5 j5 pusl` pu11ny: k5n Hunary n5 Ignaz Semmelweis m5 l`t k` Viana, Austria kvn Florence Nightingale, raan B7r7ntic v took m5 csal5 nursing.

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Kv jvn gu11th vms naath t5 xuan xot kv x1th kv jv 5 luex la n77xv xu`ny in ji`1`k in csal kv 5 miathmath.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Kv rvi run5 1980, n2n luex` k` ku`n kvn rvi du22lwal cuv mukt`p Yunaytet Y5tht22t kv ciaax g1x ju1th kvn pendv ben jak` kapv ciaax pusl` pu11ny nhial v kvl m5 gsaa kv g1x thi`x` luex` kv fsw.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Tuk kvn thi1x yithwaan piluu kv fsw kv 2009 kvn COVID-19 in c5 fsw lv thi`x kv 2020 cv naath jak` ba x`c kap nhial kv rvi w55n5 t5 xuan kv gssy l1k tetn5 kv thaabuuny kv f66 b5 raan rs gax kv kvn ju1th titi.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: C``t, p6thtvr5 t5 nyusth kv dup l1k tetn5 min gsaa cua kv la xap kv nhial kut kuakn5 l1k tin ca l`t gu11th in thieek kv du2l coown5 k` mukt`pn5 kvn gu1th nyuur` ri1thn5 k` Jvrmvn.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Ri`t m5 csal kv ‘5 l1k ran kv tet kv’ kv du]r, lotv n5 f66 thil nh6k ran kv f66 bv lu1x k1n kv jvn du]]r vms kiv bv duer in te rvi k` nsms nyuak kvvl kv nath.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Tusskv k` ri`t m5 g]r k` baybol M0thyu m2 c5 Pusntih Paylvt tet kv lak k` c1r k` f66 ba Yecu pu1t jiaath, duxdv f66 jvn v ruac m5 te kv lu]]tn5 t5 xuan k` naath tin ruac kv thok Lixvl5th.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Rvi ruaacn5 Macbeth Shakespeare, ciek in csal kv 5 Mackbeth cuv jv tok kv m5 la lakv tetkv kv f]ndv kv f66 bv ithtvn in caarv kv xivthdv woc, m5 nyoothn5 f66 woocv n5 rs k` duer in cv l1t kiv tin la comv cswdv kv f66 bv kv l1t.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Jvn ca jv jek b` vn f66 naath kv ksr k` m5 ca jv ben guic vn f66 ca ciaax ji``k l1t, cetv kv m5 la lak kvn tetkivn kv p0th v b``l min tussk k` naath tin k]x, k` cetv kv m5 la tiit kvn kuak l1k vl]x.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Min d]x, naath tin ca jak` f66 ba tetkivn lak kv ksr civxn5 ti ji`k titi, la dakv vn f66 b5 kv loc k` civx ji`k k]kivn tin we kv ben, cet kv lu`k nath baax.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: W55 r5jin5 lat kvn gssy l1k tetn5 kv ku5c pusl` pu11ny kvn ku5c nyuuthn5 civxn5 k]kivn. kv p5w duxdv f66 thilv thaabuuny m5 lak kv tet, v ciaax pal` kusth kv l1k tetn5 m5 tussk gu1th pal5 t5 xuan cet kv Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah kvn netilat yadayim k` Judaism, Lavabo k` kur5cin5 kvn Wudhu k` Yithlam. W55 r5jin5 b` lat gssy l1k ten5 kv ciaax pusl` pu11ny kv ksr k` m5 t22 kv du]]t m5 c5 raanv l1t.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Hinduism, Judaism kvn Islam ca jv lat 5 l1k tetn5 bv dhil tusk m5 c5 raan we coown5.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: K` Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism kv Yithlam laar kvnv 5 b5 raan tetkv dhil lak v xot /kenv n5 m5th, kvn ksr k` min cv m5th.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: G1x rik` gu11th l1t kv ku5c COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: G1x rik` gu11th l1t kv ku5c COVID-19 kv civx dupn5 tin tussk kv ku5c gssy` l1t kvn ciaax pusl` pu11ny kv dup tin nax jv kv g1x ju1th ksrsnabayr`th 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Kvn dup g1x rik` tin thu]]k gu11th l1t nax kvn rs kv gu11th in l`t raan th5n kvn min l`t raanv, kv ciaax kuakn5 tin tussk rivk kv pu]nydivn, d5t ku1th rvi wec, kvn ku5c civvx` rik` nath g66l5 rvi l1t v laa naath tin thi1k kv f66 dee juey COVID-19 jek.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Cet kv min ca lar v U.S. Gssy civvx` gu11th l1t kvn ciaax mukt`p` pusl` pu11ny (OSHA), l`t tin kuiy n677xdivn kv rivk ju1th kv l1t tin dak r6m ran kv naath th5n cet naath tin k]x kiv j5 l1t k00l kv raan, kv kvn tin ca ciaax g1x ju1th lat kv ku5cdivn, cet kv l1k tetn5, cu]m l11tn5 kv f66 b5 kv nyuur ci22xn5kivn m5 duaalv raan, m5 t22 kv yiiw l55k`, k` bv gu11th civvx`dv lv yivc k` bv jv moc kv wal tin la n`k luex vn gu11th in l`tv th5n.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: L`t tin te rivkdivn vn kams kv kv tin la r6m j5kivn kv naath t5 /ca x`c kiv divw kv 5 dee raan te kv juey COVID-19, duxdv f66 d]x jekv jv kv jvn k1p ju1th kv wec kvvliw vmv kiv kv j1l kam r6l5 kv th11x gu1thn5.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Kvn kvn l11t tin r7m kv naath diaal tin k]x cet kv rvi du22lg]r`, gu11th l`1t m5 xuaan naath th5n kvvl kv gu1th k7k` m5 xuan naath kvn kuak tin ksakv th5n.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: G1x rik` k` jvn bu]n vmv, kvvl kv ciaax g1x luex` min wen, cet kv l2p wernyin5 kv th55y jsam m5 gsaa m5 te th5n, nyin thiam`, kvn f66 b5 raam rs moc kv kuaak m5 gaxv rs m5 c5 ram te kc COVID-19 ben rvc.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA tiitv naath tin la l11t kv ku5c pusl` pu11ny kvn naath tin l`t gu11th kuny` nath tin c5 thi22k kv ram x1c kv kiv ram ca diw 5 cv moc COVID-19 derv a jvn rivk in d55t in dee rs rep v bv l11t tin k]x dsp m5 c5 naath dup tin we kv jism jak` /ca tit kiv d22 yithpicvmvn5 k1n tetn5kivn k` naath tin ca diw kiv ca x1c 5 moc COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: G1x rik` ju1th in gsaa kv kvn l11t titi kv kvn f66 d22 g1x cet kv thil gu22r` nath kv rs tit kv l2p wernyin5, kv l`th kuakn5 tin gax raan kv rs tin gsaa gu11th l1t.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Thi`y COVID-19 rvi fsaa derv te kv ji`k t5 xuan rvi gu1th in l`t naath th5n.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: L11t dee kv p1k gu11th l1t m5 cv raan moc juey, m5 g77rv f66 bv rad]divn tit, kiv m5 dualv kv f66 bv juey we jek.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Ciaax g1th derv rs gvr kv dup rvw, kv tin gsw tin g77r lsc nath kv kvn du]]p in d22 kv jek kv jv kvn gsy t]t] (cet kv we ksk kv thaakn5 tin thilv l1t kv kv kv n77xdivn v j5 thu]]k kiv kv th`rb5th).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Min jsak v n77x kuakn5 gu11th d]divn m5 d]x cv j5 d`k kv juey COVID-19 dervtussk 5 bv xussk. Rial5k` kv ku5c luex` ju1th kvn min ba l1t kv g1xdv d22 kv tit kv f66 ba ciaax g1x l1th nhiam.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: C11p tin ruac kv pek rik` tin nax rs kv gu11th l`tn5 kvn min l`t raanv, kv kvn gu1th tin la tussk jek ju1th th5n, rik tin tussk ciex kvn rik rvi wec, kv rik l11tn5 tin kvl cet kv naath tin dsx tin runkivn we kiv naath tin te kv ju1th t5 j``ny pu1nyn5kivn n5 wen.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Kvn ba la nyusth dup g1x tin gsw kv ciaax tiit` rikn5, knv c11p tin d22 gax min tussk kv gu11th in be kv ku5c rik` min dee lv tussk kv gu11th m5 a nhiam m5 c5 juey we tussk.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Rial5k` kv ku5c ju1thn5 tin d5t luexdivn kvn c11p tin b5 naath kv gax rs d22 kv l1t kv c1r m5 be k` wec kiv gek wec ku5c kvl.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Min lust kv lusc nath kv min tussk kv thi`y ju1th eci fsaa kv kv f66 ba d6p ju1th kv naath jak` kuiy kam j5 l1t, ba naath tin thi1k kv rivk gax ciaax rik` pusl` pu11nydivn, ba ciaax g1th l1t kv c1p m5 gsaa, k` ba ji``kdv xok b` k` naath tin t``th kuak kv f66 v vjn gu11th in tussk min cam kv th5n.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Vn d5t ju1th rvi wec gu11th in te g`pv th5n la y1rv min ca k1m raar kv ku5c g1x ju1th.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Luey c11pn5 tin gax kv juey v du]]p m5 ca ku2x piny v naath diaal rvi gu1th l1t kv gssydv kvn ciaax pusl` pu11ny l11tn5 kv luey c11pn5 t]t] v gsaa.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: M5 cv jssc vn f66 /ca rivk COVID-19 b5 lu1x kv k`p cu]x, dup g1x tin nhiam v f66 ba jv gax, v gu]]r kv v du]]p g1x in be k` kuumv, kv jsakdv v f66 b5 raan kuak g1x l1th.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Dup g1x tin cakv v f66 b5 l11t l11t nyuur k` l`tkivn v thil f66 b5 raan x`thn5 f66 ba lu`k kv du]]r in l`tv v l``t d]divn, vns v jvn kvvl in nhiam k` gsaa kv f66 ba l1th l`t.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: G1x in be k` kuumv v f66 ba ciaax gvr rvi gu1th l1t kiv ba dup k1m raar t5 g77r tiit k` l11t kvn mukt`p in xun l`t.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Kuak g1x rean kv rs (PEP) guvc kv jv 5 thilv kv lust m5 d55t k` dup g1x tin ca cak kvn ruac in be k` kuumv, duxd f66 kvn la gax kv f66 dee raan juey jek b`.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Kuak PPE diaal ba kv kuany kv t11 in we kv rivk k` l11t, ba kv kuex v gsaa cet kv min g77r kvnv, (c``t dux yieek`), v jv l1th kv v gsaa ciax, ba jv du1c w`l ciax, ba jv guic m5 cv r00t ciax k` ba jv gvr, ba jv wov kv tiit, ba jv lak, k` ba jv t]w kiv ba jv y1k m5 cv te kv luex.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Cet kv min ca lar v U.S. Gssy civvx` gu11th l1t kvn ciaax mukt`p` pusl` pu11ny (OSHA), l`t tin kuiy n677xdivn kv rivk ju1th kv l1t tin dak r6m ran kv naath cet naath tin k]x kiv j5 l1t k00l kv raan.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: C11p g1x ju1th tin nhiam tin ca lar kv ku5c l11tn5 diaal kv kvn f66 dee raan tet kv malv lak ciax, d22 l1t com kv f66 b5 kv nyuur ci22xn5kivn m5 cv raan moc juey, g1x jsam in be r77l ran cet kv kum thusk m5 kivl raan, kum wu]m m5 thiam raan, th7p wargakn5 puc` kvn kuak tin ba kv yusr th5n, rial5k` kv ruac kv pussn m5 g77rv jv kiv l1t kv g2r nath kv rs kv thaakn5, luek nath kv f66 /c5 kv b5 l`t kv kuak k]kivn5, kvn f66 ba piny coth k` ba du1c wal tin wooc luex.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Xi`c raam m5 cv moc juey kvn f66 ba jv jak` nyuur gu11thdv k2rsa v kvn m5 bum-bum kv g1x l11tn5 , naath g77r xsak k` mukt`p, gu``l, kv naath tin k]x rvi l1t.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Vn U.S. Mukt`pn5 g1x ju1th kvn k`pdv cu]x (CDC) ca jv lat vn f66 l11t tin ca diw 5 tussk nyuuthn5 ju1th l55k` k` raan b5 kv dhil nyuur ci22xn5kivn am`n5 m5 cv jssc 5 lthil kv leth pu11ny, nyuuth leth` pu11ny, kiv nyuuthn5 k]kivn kv thaakn5 t5 24 v thil f66 k`n raan wal tin la yuth l2th pu11ny piny, kv f66 p`l raam m5 te kv juey ba jak` t22 th5n v lsr, ba l11t jak` nyur ciex kv f66 tiit raan watdv d]divn, kvn f66 kvn l11t b5 kvn puslvth5n5 dhil x1c.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Cet kv m5 ca lar v OSHA, rik tin te jekdivn vn kams kv kvn tin g77r f66 gu22r naath rskv k11th b1kvl (1.8 m) kv naath t5 /c5 x`c kiv ca diw 5 te kv COVID-19, duxdv f66 d]x cv kv k`p kv SARS-CoV-2 in tussk rvi wec gu11th in te g`pv th5n, kiv kv f66 d]x v ram pay ben j`l r66l d]divn m5 c5 thi11x kv juey COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Kv kvn l11t tin r6m kv wec kvvliw cet kv rvi du22lg]r`, gu11th l1t m5 xuan naath tin l`t th5n, kvn gu11th k7k` m5 ksakv kuak t5 xuan th5n k` xuan naath tin k7k th5n. C11p g1x tin gsaa kv jvn gu11th vmv kvn bu]n inthi1k kv rivk vmv kv kvn f66 ba thiiy jsam m5 d55t k` gsaa ku2x th5n, ba wernyin5 jak` xuan kv f66 b5 j1l jsam d5t, ba t5 gax kam nath l1th th5n cet kv pil11thik thiam`, ba wernyin l1th kam l``t` kvn naath tin g77r xsak. C11p g1x tin xun kuumv kv kvn bu]n in thi1k kv rivk kvn tin; ba l11t tin cv moc juey p1l f66 b5 kv nyuur ci22xn5kivn, ba dusl in guic naath waxdivn th5n gvr kv ruac v n1n, b5 naath rs g0r kv thaakn5, ba j`l tin nyu]n-nyu]]n p`l tin we gu1thn5 tin cv pok kv juey COVID-19, ba ciaax l1t kv lusc thiecn5 kv p0th m5 t22 kv m5 guic l11tv, ba l11t l1r min tussk ciax kv x55c kv ku5c rik` COVID-19 kvn ciaax g1xdv min d]x pay lv ben raar, ba l11t tin d22 b5y l1t in pay ben kv ku5c g1x ju1th xieec kv l`thdv kvvl kv kuak g1x tin nyin ran krsa kv t11 in derv l`th kv, ba kuak xun kvn ciaax kv ku5c pusl1 pu11nygu11th l1t kvn ciaax pusl` pu11ny nath tin l`t vn w1ns, g6r k` f66 b5 raan tet kv lak ciaax rvi thaakn5, ba naath g66r xsaan5 jak` be rvc v kuiy, kvn ben wec kvvliw gu11th l1t kv f66 ba min g77r kvnv ben jek, k` ba l``r5 nyoth kv g]]r kv ku5c civvx` min dee raan v lak tet kv kvvl kv c11p g1c COVID-19 tin k]x. V nax rs du]]r in l`t raanv gu11th l1t, l11t tik pek ciaax in dee raanv jek rivk vn kams derv gsaa kv kv vn f66 dee raan kuak g1xdv kv rs ku2x cet kv mat kuex` curapn5 tetn5, b5y gssn` l1t, kuum nhiam kiv kuum thusk kvn wum, kiv gsgvl.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: L11t tin te rvi bun` rik` nvmv dak g6rivn kv nyin yieek`.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: M5 cv raan moc kv juey rvi ri11y nhial, c11p g1x t5 gsw kv f66 b5 l11t mal kvvl kv j11l tin k]x kvn tin; ba ram in cv moc juey woc rvi nath v bv n1n kv kv kv k11th t5 cet kv 6 k` k1th ci7k`, ba l``t kvl k` l11t jivc ri11y jak` tiit ram vms, k` bv jv moc kuum nhiam vn gu1n ju1th kv f66 bv thokdv kum kvn wumdv kv b5y kiv wargak m5 kivlv kiv thiamv.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: L``t ri11y vms bv curapn5 tetn5 dhil l1th tin la y1kv min tiit v gu1n ju1th kiv poocv x6k kvn ruvy gu1n ju1th kiv kuak tin k]kivn tin cv moc l1k-l11k, bv rs rep kv kuak tin la gax raan kv rs m5 vn gu1n ju1th v j1``l vms t22 kv l2th pu11ny, kiv yieyv kv rooth.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Curapn5 kvn kuak k]kivn tin d22 y1k ba kv dhil y1k rvi bvk` min te kv w`l n1k luex`, k` ba kuak tin cv gu22r kv luex coth kv w`l in n`k luex kv ksrv. M5 v baabuur g1th cet kv baabuur j1l tvth` lsaac kvn j`l k]kivn, nyin g1x rik` kv kvn f66 b5 j1l p1k m5 te raan kv juey, kvn f66 b5 raan nyuur gu11thdv k`rsa kvn th7p l``r` k` j5 pusl` pu11ny tin te rvi baabuur` m5 cv ram kvl moc l2th pu11ny kiv nyuuthn5 k]kivn min t22 rvi baabuur`.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: V thu]k, guur wal bv cu tussk k` ram cv moc juey m5 ca nyu]]r gu11thdv k`rsa. K` du2lg]r` kvn gu11th yoop` gan, CDC cv jv lar 5 ba kv g1k kv gu11th m5 tst kv f66 ba kv coth kv w`l in n`k luex m5 c5 ram cv moc juey ben du22lg]r` c`x v juey m5 /ken fsw thi`x.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: M5 c5 juey fsw thi`x v m``th kiv v lvm rvi wec, b5 naath nyuur kiv cu]x kv kam kvn f66 ba j`l p`l kvn du]]l5 tin la r7m naath th5n, kv m11tn5 tin la xuan naath th5n cet kv l1t yithpust kiv k2t din kiv nyuur gu11th mieth k` kapt5ria, ba kam ksamn5 jak` n1n, ba thaak in be kv naath kvn jivvn nath jak` kuiy, ba gu``l tin thil m5 com m5 be kv kv jak` thil, k` ba gu11th pusl` pu11ny t`th rvi du22lg]r` kv ku5c gan tin tussk nyuuthn5 t5 cet kv nyin piluu k` kv.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: M5 cv te kv d5t vn d6p ju1th kv naath rvi wec, kvvl kv cu]x nath kv kam kvn nyuur kv kam, ba du2lg]r` dhil k1p cu]]x. Bv te kv du]]r m5 l1t kv v xut kv ciaax g1x nath kv juey, la CDC v cua guic vn f66 b5 rivk ku00.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: L`th xut` l`t v l11t kuumv tin la dhil v r7m kv naath tin k]x tin ca x1c 5 cv moc juey kvn tin divw kv n5 kv 5 cv moc COVID-19 gsw kv kv guur du]]p g1x v la nyin rik` pusl` pu11ny m5 rup-rup ka l11t, kvvl kv l`th nath kv kuak g1x ju1th.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: M5 naath rs gu22r v thi1k kv gu11th in te naath kv dual, l11t ba nyin l1tdivn dhil coth kv wal tin wooc luex kvn f66 ba kuak ci22xn5kivn nysk kv m5 du1c kvk kv wal kiv ba kv yivc, k` ba dup tin d22 gax rs gu]]r kv ts1w kvn y1k k` tin c5 l`t kv kv kvn f66 ba bieyn5 lak.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: OSHA nhskv th11x civxn5 yoop` pusl` pu11ny kvn yoop nath tin koony naath vn f66 bv la jvn du]]p in d55t in g1x kv d6p ju1th kv naath.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Rivk in d55t kv jek ju1th v th7p nath kv ciaax yoop` pusl` pu11ny, lu`k, l1t k` lab, kvn naath tin j``l kuak wal tin c5 thi22k kv naath tin cv moc juey kiv ca diw 5 te kv juey COVID-19.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kvn titi dee kvn rik t5 d5t kv jek ju1th m5 c5 l11t ciaax in th6p kv jism kv jv l1t, kiv ca yithpicvmvn5 k1n kv ku5c th2m k` naath t5 ca x`c 5 cv moc juey kiv t5 ca diw 5 cv moc juey COVID-19.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Dup tin th6p kv jism kv kv kv kvn titi; cot dupiir` rvi pu]]th, dup tin n77x kivl, th2m r``l lsaac, th11x c11pn5 l1t lvc kvn th2mdivn, kiv k1n yithpicvmvn rvi pu]]th.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Rik l1t kuny`nath tin nhiam v f66 naath tin rial kv pu1ny nath tin c5 l5w 5k` kv f66 ba kv kony tin ca x1c kiv ca diw 5 l5w kv COVID-19; vns lapv a rivk m5 d55t m5 dee naath n6x juey m5 c5 kv l`t kv ciaax th2m kv ksr lieth ran. nysk c1p in ca cak kv ku5c g1x k` jvn bu]n vmv v f66 ba ran nax dueelv k`rsa m5 ca x1c kiv ca diw 5 te kv COVID-19 m5 l1t kv du]]p th7p` jsam k` jv.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: Yithpicvmvn5 ba kv dhil k1n kv ciaax teek` kv pek tiit`.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: Vn mukt`p pusl` pu11ny wec mu]]n (WHO) cv jv lar 5 j5 ju1thn5 tin be rvc ba kv ns11n kv naath tin k]x k` b5 kv liep du2l5 l5p` k`r] v nax rs pek k` f66 m5 ca kv x1c kiv ca kv diw 5 cv kv moc kv COVID-19. Kvvl kv PPE, OSHA cv jv lar vn f66 ba nyin yieek` ku2x v naath tin l`t kv k11th 6 kv thi22kdivn kv j5 ju1thn5 tin ca x1c kiv ca diw 5 cv moc SARS-CoV-2, kvn naath tin th6p kv jism.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: K` Yunaytet Y5tht22t, NIOSH cv N95 th55y` jsam lar 5 d22 jv ku2x kiv gsaa f66 d22 jv ku2x kv gu11th in c5 dual tussk kv jv, psrg5r11m in ca g]r kv kuexdv v gsaa, x55cdv k` naath kvn ciaax th2m.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: Nyin yieek` tin k]x la th6p kv ciaax g1x m5 gsaa b` k` ba l11t jak` gsaa ciaaxdivn rvi l1t. Vn WHO /cv jv lar 5 kum rs kvvliw, kv f66 COVID-19 v juey l55k` k`rsa v /c5 ms a f66 d22 jv jek kv p5 pu11ny tin k]x.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: WHO cv jv lar 5 l`thn5 kuum tet` k`rsa kv gu11th coth kv l11t tin thvm naath rvc.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: K` naath tin k1n yithpicvmvn5 k` li11k kv ku5c th2m, tiit kiv f66 b5 ram cv moc kv COVID-19 kap v thil dup tin gax kv jism, WHO laarv jv 5 kum rs kv kuum ret`, gsgvl, kiv kuum nhiam, k v b5y gssn` kvvl kv curapn5 tetn5.

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: M5 cv jssc vn f66 dak curapn5 PPE, WHO cv jv lar 5 ba min g77r PPE jak` kuiy kv du]]p telewal, g11xn5 tin jsc cet kv wernyin5, b5 ben5 naath tin yoop raan rvc k`r] du22l in ca gu1n ju1th COVID-19 nax th5n, l1t kv PPE kv f66 l1t kvn5 kvl m5 x1c kv, guur ran kv f66 cv kuum yieek` b5 woc am`n5 m5 c5 l1t in l`tv thu]k min thvmv naath tin cet jueydivn kv jv vns, rsm th5n kam` nath tin n77x PPE ciax kvn f66 ba naath l1t f66 ba kuumn5 p`l m5 l`t kvn naath t5 thil nyuuthn5 t5 cet kv nv t].

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).

sourceString: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: b’Angiotenthin in r55t endhaam 2 (ACE2) v endhaam m5 cv dsap raar (cell membraan5) cell5 pu]]th, arter5n5, lsc rok kvn c5n.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 la r6mv kv l`t tin rhieek kv angiotenthin in r55t endhaam (ACE) kv xu]kdv kvd5t angiotentin II kvn r2pdv kv ANG (1-7) k` jakv jv k` w`l m5 cet gsaa kv tu]m ju1thn5 lsaac. ACE2 b` l`tv v la gu11th in coth kvcell5 rvc k` th11x ksrsnabayr`th.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Endhaam ran in c``t kv jv csalv hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Angiotenthin in r55t endhaam 2 t22 kv yi22th dh5xkendhaam jssk wec endsthelial kvn cell5 tin k]x.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: ACE2 protein t22 kv N-terminal peptidathv M2 dsmvvny kv C-terminal kslvkt5r5n renal amino athid dsmvvny in j``l jv.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 v la cothv k` kvvl I membran protein, m5 te edhaamatikslv kv dsmvvny m5 t2k m5 cup jssk cell5 pu]]th kvn cu]]x tin k]x.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Vn dsmvvny celluar in d]x k` ACE2 jvn jivnv k` tu1n5thmembran dsmvvny kv endhaam d]divn m5 csal 5 cvdathv, k` protein in we n66x la reepv rs rvi rivm k` bv d5tdv we nax rvi coown5.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 t22 th5n k` cu]]x pu11ny diaal: ACE2 jvn cv rs dsap k` cell membran v d5t k` pu]th vl]x k` pek albislsr cell5 II rvi c55n tin tsaatn5, r`l lsaac kvn bvnuthn5 endsthvlial cell kv r`l lsaac tin puath-puaath k` cu]]x pu11ny t5 xuan.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: ACE2 mRNA b` jvn jek jv rvi xith` thvr5bvral ksrt0k, ithtriatum hypsthvlam1th kvn cuut xith`.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: L1t ACE2 in nhiam v f66 bv l`t v la kueen cux` ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE jivnv k` angiotenthin I hsrmsn we rvi bathksnith5r5tix angiotenthin.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 nysk naxv carbskthaal-terminal amino athid phenylalanine k` angiotethin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) kv hydrolyses rvi bathsdilvtsr angiotenthin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 derv peptaadn5 k]kivn ti xuan nax cet kv [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, kv ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 b` jvn r5tv membrane kv g1x amino athid in cux k` rsa kv j1lv kv SLC6A19 k` ca jv liam rvi ju1th Hartnup.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Cet kv tu1n5thmembran protein, ACE2 l`tv v la gu11th in nhiam in coth cell5 th11x ksrsnabyr`th rvc t] cet kv HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (bayr`th in n77x SARS; KV SARS-CoV-2 (bayr`th in n77x COVID-19).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Kv guecdv v civk, mat ithpak S1 protein dux SARS-CoV kvn SARS-CoV2 v we k` endhaamatik dsmvvny dux w55 ACE2 cell5 la n77xv endsthayth5th kvn nax bayr`th kvn jvn endhaam rvi endothsmvth in te rvi cell5.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Vn wedivn rvc vmv g77rv rial5k` S proteink` thvrin psrsteath TMPRSS2, gu11th civvx` min te piny thiec` min g6r kv vn walv v la ciaax in dee naath lu`k. Vns cv naath nax k` f66 xu]k pek ACE2, rvi cell5 d]x derv naath lu`k kv k7r ju1th vmv.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: Kuv la f66 bun nath t5 xuan k` k5mn5 kvn gu1th lu`x` ca jv lar 5 wiaa kvvl kv ACE kvn ARB kv ciaax lu`kdivn.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Nysak g7r` x`c` kv c1p kvn guec kv meta m5 c5 ben raar kv 11 pay b1rsw, 2012, cv jv jek vn f66 l1t kv ACE yin5b5tsr cv thi22k kv gssy m5 34% kv xu]k rik` pneumonia m5 ca jv p``r kv g1xdv.

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: Nysk m5 waa kv m5 r2p kv jv, rivk pneiumonia cua jv xok b` k` j5 ju1th t5 ca tom kv ACEyin5b5tsr t5 cv cuit vl]x kv pneumonia, v civk kvn t22 te kv ithtsrsk kvn thil l1t lsaac.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: L1t kv ACE yin5b5tsr b` ca jv ksx thieek kv xu]kdv kv kv li` in n77x pneumonia jv, c`x min kn vn in tussk c`x m22 ca jv guic 5 c/cv thieek kv rivk in n77x pneumonia.

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Mat ACE2 k` raan (rhACE2) jvn v lu``k m65 rvl rs kv bu]t m5 c5 tussk rvi pu]]th v rup-rup k` cv jssv vn f66hemod5namik lsaac kvn skth5j5n ttacurvcin rvi piglet` kv ipopolysaccharide xok kvn nyuuthn5 tin tussk k` li``k.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Nuth civvx` t22k` rhACE2 k` raan v thaakn5 10 kv tukdv v minitn5 t5 30 kvvl kv pek m5 thaakn5 t5 24.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Kv t5 xuan tin ca jek nyooth kvn f66 rhACE2 derv la w`l m5 d22 gsaa k` naath tin thil luth kv k5l11thik renin-angiotenthin yinibitsr (RAS yinibitsr) kiv rvi ju1thn5 tin j`l rvi angiotenthin II cv rs. Kap nhial rhACE2 ca jv kap nhial rvi dueelwal kv f]]nkv tu]m nyuuth` ju1th l55k` min p0th.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: b’COVID-19 apsl5k22cin5 kv nyin mobaal` t5 ca l1tk kv f66 thieek nath v jek` kv ku5c 2019-20 ksrsnabayr`th in thi``x fsw, cet kv ciaax in n0n kv jv k` naath itn cv k`p tin d]x c5 te kvvl kv naath tin cv k`p.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: Apslvk22cin5 t5 xuaan ca kv l1t kiv ca kv lar 5 gsaa v kuumv kv lu`k xut` kv naath rvi w55n5 th11xkivn.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Ca dup tin d22 l`t a pslik22cin5 tin la nvvn juey jek kv ciaax in ba kv l1t kv jv.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Cv c11p g1x kuakn5 nvvn5 k]kivn kap nhial, v civk cet kv t11 in dee l`t kv apsl5k22cin tin jek kiv nyooth gu1th tin te naath th5n tin te kv kvn apsl5k22cin5 titi.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: C1p d]divn in dee ku00 k` gsaa derv a l1t kv bluetooth kv l11r kv log kv ran in thi1k kv cellpussn.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Kv 10 pay xuaan 2020, g6gvl kvn apsl kvvl cua jv lar 5 baa l1t mat kvvl kv du]pp in dee l`t kv bluetooth kv apslik22cin5 v coth k` andsrsidn5kivn kvn iOS kvvl.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: K` china kuumv china kvvl kv alipy, cv apslik22cin k1m raar m5 jak naath k` f66 ba nvn tin c5 thieek kv naath tin cv k`p kv COVID-19.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Ja l`t vn t``mv rvi w55n5 t5 b``l 200 k` r0k china. K` Singapore, ca apsl5k22cin l1t m5 csal 5 Tracktogether ja th5n l`tv.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: Vn apslik22cin cua jv l1t v IT rvi wecdivn, cua jv k1m raar v f66x k` ba jv k1m kuumv. Nsth Macedonia cv apsl5k22cin m5 csal 5 ‘stopkorona’ l1tm5 l`t kv bluetooth kvvl m5 nyooth naath tin cv moc kv kiv c5 thieek kv naath tin cv moc luex ju1th k` dee kv cu jak` we du22lwal v j5 lu`x` pusl` pu11ny.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: Vn apslik22cin cua jv l1t v minithvr ksmsnik22cinkvn t0knslsj5 kv minthvr pusl` pu11ny.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Kn gu11th m5 cet kv 14 pay xuaan 2020, cuv vn apslik11cin cuv te l5p` kv f66 ba jv thvm v g6gvl play ithtssr kv apsl ithtsst.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Kn 12 pay xuaan, cu kuumv jv lar 5 apslk22cin in nyoooth naath tin c5 thieek kv j5 ju1th ja dup l1t jv, k` jvn bv te th5n kv rvi juskn5 tin c5 thi1k. Apslk22cin d]divn m5 c``t kv jv ja th5n l1t jv k` Ireland, kvn Pvrvvny (stopCovid).

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australia kvvl kvn New Zealand kvn kaa guic f66 d22 apslk22cin l1t m5 cet kv dux Singapoe in csal 5 TraceTogether kvn BlueTrace prsrstok77l. Raciaguicv f66 bv geofencing app l1t kv nen j5 ju1th COVID-19 tin ciex k` Moscow, m5 l1t kv kv f66 ba /ken kv we ci22xn5.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: We kv ksr g7r` kv wargak in b6r ‘Appn5 Gone Rogue: G1x kuakn5 tin r00l k` gu11ndivn kv kv n5n thi`y` ju1th rvi fsaa m22 be raar kv 2020. Du]]r kvl d]divn m5 c``t kv jv v SafeTrace p5l11tpussm v Enigma MPC, ksmpan5 m5 t``th nyin t0knslsj5 m5 tussk kv gu11th 2 nhiam k` MIT M5dia Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Nyuuth ksrsnabayr`th 2 in d55t (SARSCoV-2) v nyuuth ksrsnabayr`th l55k`, m22 n0n kv kv nhiam k` naath di]k t5 te kv pneumonia m5 cv mat kv juey in l55k` min d55t k` Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Raar pu11ny ran, vn bayr`th la thaabuuyn jv a n`k, min dhi`y kuumn5 kv. SARS-CoV-2 c``tv a thi1k vl]x kvn SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Kvn pu]th kv kvn cu]]x in la luvvx COVID-19 jv vl]x kv f66 bayr`th la cop thvl5 l== in cv k`p kv endhaamaxgi6tvnthin in r55t endhaam 2 (ACE2), min c5 mat k` bu]n II k` albislsr thvl5 pu]]th.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: Vn bayr`th bv w5c m5 rvl rs m5 csal5 g5layk6protein in csal kv “yithpaak” (pep5lsmvr) jak` gu11thdv kv f66 bv we rs tusm k` ACE2 k` bv cu we rvc th0l5 l== in cv hap.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: Cua b0c lsaac m5 d55t jek k` 12% nath tic cv k`p t5 ca n66x du22lwal rvi Wuhan, China, k` jvn xuan locdv krs k` juey m5 d55t.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: Thsrsboth5th m5 d55t kvl m5 la tussk (13%) kvn ben6th thsrsmboembsl5dh5m (25) cua kv jek k` ICU gu1n ju1th luex` COVID-19 k` d]x dee kv thil yoop` m5 gsaa. Th2m ksr lieth `k naath tin c5 l5w kv COVID-19 ca jek t22 kv d`k albislsr (DAD), kvn lipsthaat mi te rvidv kv pu]t piny pu]]th.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: M11th taapn5 cu kvn v 1.4 kv b1livn kv jekdivn kv nyuuthn5 COVID-19 t5 nyin d5ts k` cetv kv m5 v 2.4 vn f66 dee kvn yoop m5 d55t g7r kiv dee kv l5w m5 ca we p11r kv kv kv naath tin /c5 m`th kv tap. Cua nyin diiw` lsaac kap nhial b` kv ciaax j`ny` ju1th th5n.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: J5 lu`x` du22lwal k` Hong Kong cua nyu0r m5 20% v we k` 30% jek rvi liu`x` pu]]th k` th11x nath t5 c5 x]]th kv juey, k` th2m pu]]th nyoothv ji``k cuux` nvms.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Vns jvn b` derv naath nax k` f66 ba yoop nyuuthn5 tiit` we nysk kv l1t kv ksr k` m5 c5 raan x]]th.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Kv pay di]k 2020, cua jv x1c 5 m5 luex 2 c5 we ben kv bu1x bum` pu11ny m5 b5 liep k` naath tin c5 x]]th.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Lu1x bum` pu11ny jsscv cet kv m5 naxv r kv ciaax ksrsnabayr`thn5 tin k]x, duxdv f66 pek in c5 x]]th kv COVID-19 cv lv ben jssc b` ca kv lv nysk kv jek ksrsnabayr`th kv n5n tin jsak ca lv ben lar.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Kvn ca jv guic cet xotn5 vn luex 2 wal th5n v /c5 ms a luex d]divn m5 pay tussk.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Vn bayr`th ca jv guic tusskv k` k` rsa rvi leyn5, cuv kulv ben tvth k` rran kv luex.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Vn tukdv min thu]k /ca jv x`c, duxdv f66 kv pay w`lrvw 2019 d`k luex` rvi fsaa cua jv nvn jivnv k` raan we kv raan kv d6pdv.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: G6r x`c` m22 nhiam k` pek m5 41 m5 ca x`th k` COVID-19, 2 be rasr kv pay kvl 2020 k` Lathvt, nyoothv c`x in nhiam in tussk kv nyuuthn5v la 1 k` pay w`lrvw 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: C``p t5 xuak naathv l`tdivn kv f66 baa pek lieth xok.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Knv ku00n titi gu1c kv wec kvn gu11th k` knv b` nax kvn rs pek d5t` th2m, ciaax gssy` yoop` pusl` pu11ny, ciaax tum`, gu11th in tookv fsw kv thi1x kvn t11 civvx` nath cet run, wut/ciek kvn ciaax pusl` pua11ny kvvliw.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Kv guut 2019, cu WHO juey moc ICD-10 kv p0th kv ksst U07.1 kv ku5 naath tinc5 l5w k` lab t5 nyooth f66 luex SARS-CoV-2 kvn U07.2 kv ku5c lieth du22lwal kvn COVID-19 in ca nvn epid5mslsj5ksl5 v thil lab k` nyooth luex SARS-CoV-2. Vn rvci66 li`th v we k` pek in ca x`th nyoothv ku00n lieth t5 ca d``k` pek nath tinca thvm kv pek thaakn5 t5 ca kuex piny.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Kv yithtat5thtic Yunib7thvt5 Johnhopkinith, pek li1th w55 mu]]n v we k` rvci66 nath tin ca x`th v 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) kv gu11th pay xuaan 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Vn pekdivn kuv gu`c k` w55. Th22mn5 k]kivn kv pek lieth (CFR), m5 nyooth pvrthn in ca thvm tin c5 l5w kv jvn juey kvn pek lieth kv jvn luex (IFR), min nyoothpvrthvn nath tin (ca thvm kvn tin /k1n thvm) tin c5 l5w kv jvn juey.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Kvn yithtat5thtik /c5 kv rs nax kv gu11th thaakn5 k` /ca guurn5 du]]p kvl k` naath tin th0m kv luex kvn t11 in dee thuk vn peks tussks.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: Vn ji``k ju1th fsaa kvn liethdv kvvl te kvn kv d``k k` wutn5 kvn m`n.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: K` China, pek lieth v 2.8 pvrthvn k` wutn5 k` v 1.7 pvrthvn k` m`n.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: Min la lusk k` nvmv in thu]k kv d``k m``n kvn wutn5 /ca jv x`c, duxdv f66 jvnvtic kvn t11 civvx` d]x derv a jvn.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
